fVGbUo-P9ADPaJi9oR5eZQ.text: My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. The garlic tuna nigiri is so delicious. AYCE is a bit pricy, but totally worth it. I have no idea where they get their fish, but the quality is amazing.   Someone wrote that they prefer Xtreme Sushi, and made some comment about the plating here. I urge that yelper to go have a meal at Xtreme and enjoy the wasabi-less and ginger-less plates of sushi made with super warm over cooked rice (which isn't even short grain sushi rice), oh and the unidentifiable fish.

6q5tqr-yJLN1kjM3abC51w.text: My fav AYCE in Las Vegas! Def have good quality and it's always busy but never too busy. Restaurant is always full but never a wait.

_wINe1XJJhZeVAemZipO6w.text: The staff and service was good.  The sushi was awful.  I tried five different items and they were all bad.  I did nt eat any more even though i was still hungry.  Felt sick after.  I have been eating sushi for 25 years I love it but not at this place

L2eW_KyGwbC8-LPY4539mg.text: We are regulars here. The San Francisco fire is amazing! All the rolls are amazing. The downside is their policies are rigid and tend to make the experience not so great. It's next to a sbux and you CANNOT bring in coffee, but they also don't offer coffee. Their iced tea is low quality and not good. The apple saki is amazing though! They are sticklers for the late night special. Everyone MUST buy a drink, even if 3 out of 4 are drinking alcohol, they will penny pinch you (we are talking the difference of a dollar!). We in fact love this place but management definitely needs to change their policies.

ElQ4-AWsVD-i5PHNMlx0zA.text: Sushi Twister has go it going on!  I love this place because they have nigiri down to an art man. Their cuts of fish are just outstanding and the taste is like.. OMG WOW SUSHI YESSSS.  I have a few friends that I go to when I want to know anything Sushi so when they said that this is the place, I took their word without question and I was not at all disappointed.  They have a wide variety of fish for nigiri and from my understanding (according to my sushi expert friends) Twister has probably got some of the freshest fish you can find on your nigiri in Vegas and not only that but apparently they know how to prepare the fish authentically.  On top of that their selection of specialty rolls is pretty massive and I definitely applaud them for their creativity. Going back to my sushi expert friends, they really only like nigiri but apparently the rolls here utilize the same great fish that's on the nigiri that they don't mind having a few specialty rolls as well.  Now, I am by no means an expert on sushi but when the food is good.. the food is good and the food here is DAMN good.  My only real problem with this place is unlike Sushi-Mon and the newly opened Goyemon, Twister does not offer all you can eat dessert which is a real bummer since I would love to have like 4-5 pieces of mochi ice cream like I normally do at Sushi-Mon as opposed to the one piece that they cut in half to make two at Twister.  Fortunately for them, I won't remove a star because like I have been saying.. the food is f^&#ing good. :)  For out of towners. This is not within reasonable driving distance of the strip so unless you're staying for a while and you're with other locals.. I wouldn't suggest it. It would be worth the drive if you have the time though.

SeAql6Y-c4AkJiFMaLEUqA.text: My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. I live in San Francisco and we don't have any all-you can eat sushi place. Every time I come to Vegas I have dinner here. Fresh, yummy, and fun.

dzZ-zMMHGnOiQQIc9vyrzA.text: I can't give this more than 2 stars because the service last night absolutely STUNK.  I was really bummed because my brother LOVES this place and has been bugging us to try it for months.  I couldn't wait to give it a shot. The AYCE sushi itself was good.  Pretty standard in my opinion, but nothing bad.  We really liked the Mexican roll and I thought the albacore and garlic tuna were really yummy.  None of the others really stood out.  But on to the part that drops it down to 2 stars (and ensures I'll never be back).  The service was unbelievably slow.  I mean REALLY slow.  Granted, they only had two sushi chefs and one waitress and the place was almost full... but hey that's not my fault.  Get some more staff!  And while you're at it... get some food servers with a decent personality!  Meh... sorry Sushi Twister.  I know you have your fans, but I'm not one of them.  I'm going back to Sin City next time I have my AYCE craving!

1GPeu4pjBdKdDF4Uc0Xecw.text: Sushi was fresh, well made, and quite tasty. It's a real small place you would hardly notice driving by. But it's worth a stop. We didn't do the all you can eat special they offer. The rolls, nigiri, and sake were all exceptional.

UkQxkvZUARFGlGLYSNnsiA.text: The three of us sat up to the bar and watched our sushi be made.  The sushi chef was excellent and taught some as he went along.  He catered to our every whim and gave us full stomachs without repeating any dish until we had tried everything that sounded appealing to us (or twenty types).  Finally they rolled us out of the place, full, happy, and still enough money in our pockets to repeat the experience again another night.

0LKiQeN6X5AWxOUPev_zAA.text: OMG All the chefs and dishwashers and servers and host or ess greet you at the same time as you walk in. They ask if its your 1st time here and i said yes because it was. They explained all that was included in AYCE sushi. I felt at home. The chefs constantly check up on you and the quality of the sushi. Which ya know before i really ate the good stuff. I thought the stuff they have at a buffet was decent. WELL NOT ANYMORE. PFFFT BUFFET SUSHI EWWWW ICK. Sushi Twister is great. I dont like scallops but I recommend trying Dynamite which is Baked scallops on a half shell and they still come out frying to your table. DELIC. And i love how most rolls come out in half portions if you request it so you can try more. There is one with Mango sauce on top OMG it was great. And they give you a stamp card. I think this one in my eyes tops them all. I shall be back. And i dont pass around 5 stars lightly but this one i think ill make my residence SUSHI DEN.

XF2cD2q75IWKqj0QEF7U6A.text: Very good! Small restaurant, but the quality is great. Lots of variety and friendly staff. Decent wait this time, but service was instant once we were seated. Will be back!

zXXDpy_Oi2ERoKK2Aw3OuA.text: This place is awesome. The food is fantastic. The bento box is huge. Service was awesome,  this place was jumpin... will definitely return.

PiVhF8TJQ6zKbEq1c8-ZXg.text: This place is a relatively short drive from work, which makes it work for my 1 hour time frame.   I've eaten here a few times on my own, and most recently, I ate with a co-worker during our break.   We were seated quickly, our drink order taken immediately and brought out shortly after.   I LOVE that they do half roll orders! I never feel like I get my money worth when doing AYCE because I try not to over-eat, so I am limited in the variety I get to choose.   We ordered off the AYVE menu and it was well worth it. With the half orders available, we were able to try 9 different styles and appetizers. It was the perfect amount of food between the 2 of us. We didn't feel like we needed to overeat to get to try more variety and we left feeling well fed but not overstuffed.   The service was amazing the whole time, with the owner(?) personally waiting on us and checking in on our experience. We had a great time and were not rushed to get back to the office. We had plenty of time to drive there, eat without rushing and drive back with a couple minutes to spare.   The prices are decent, though it's still a bit much for lunch. I can't complain as we still enjoyed AYCE with no issues.   I will definitely be back, and hopefully we'll have the same experience.

UVk47JaCg5Dia35sr7qXsA.text: The all you can eat choice is great if you can pack food into your stomach. It's not buffet style (pre-made and slowly rotting as the unwashed masses touch the food and put it back when they change their minds), and instead you order from the waitress. It's great that this isn't a buffet and there's no time limit to ordering, but the bad side is that you can't just get food when you want it. This encourages people to order *a lot* at once and invariably the you end up with more food than your stomach can handle.  The rolls themselves are quite tasty, each one a mix of the basic fish (tuna, salmon, yellowtail) with other maki standards such as crab, avocado, tempura, sweet and/or spicy sauces, etc. You'll definitely find a few that you'll like given that there seem to be about 20 rolls on the menu.   On top of rolls and sushi, the AYCE allows you to order anything else they serve as well, so you could really gorge yourself on dumplings and salad if that was your fancy. I believe the only thing with a limit are the mochi ice creams of which you're only allowed one.  No big deal since by the time dessert rolled around, I was so stuffed that I involuntarily gave our nice waitress the stinkeye when she asked me if I wanted mochi as well.  Sushi Twister is fun with some interesting decor choices (why are there two carpet dryers on a display area near the ceiling???). The wait staff is super nice and friendly if a bit overworked when I went for a saturday lunch; there was only one girl working the whole restaurant.  I really do like this place and have come back quite a few times when visiting Vegas.  Just remember that as with any type of AYCE, be ready for eater's remorse.

fYIGfub2HO1zog7UfszyiA.text: A absolute love this place. My husband and I have been coming here for years now. Never a disappointment. Everyone I bring here with me becomes a lover. I always get the ll you can eat and the variety of sushi and appetizers is amazing. I recommend the tiger Yamasaki roll or the matsuri roll.

YYPdsLMBqdCSFLRluFc10Q.text: This review is not based on the sushi as I am no fan of sushi but ate here because my family wanted to eat here.  I had their lunch special Teriyaki Bowl with Fillet Mignon.  I liked the teriyaki sauce and the meat was very tender and flavorful.  This also came with Miso Soup which was also very good.  The only thing that would have made the bowl better is if it came with some type of vegetables instead of just meat and rice.  Our server was very nice and friendly, constantly refilling our drinks without us ever needing to ask (maybe because they automatically charge an 18% gratuity on parties of 6 or more).  I wouldn't mind coming back here in the future if my family wanted to eat here again.

Ja0RjvgbcdDOnq9St2Xytw.text: We went here since Yama sushi was too busy. The food was good but service wasn't. Our party of 5 got the "big" table and it seemed it was an inconvenience to them because many people were waiting for that. Our wait between orders was long. Everything was a long wait even for a refill, a napkin or a glass of water. The our server even had the nerve to ask if we were actually gonna finish everything and didn't even wait for us to even finish ordering... she just left! I guess I understand that they were extremely busy but they shouldn't have made that our fault. We didn't ask for that table or to have our food take long to be served. I guess what matters is that the food was pretty good. I still prefer Yama for food and service!

PkNUlh1liOfdKFvvghrpBQ.text: The AYCE menu is full items you can only order once and most of the rolls are smothered in a sauce they call Japanese salsa.  It has ok flavor but in most cases it masks the taste of the fish.  The staff is amazing and very attentive!  It was a good experience but not my overall favorite in town.

CZe5u5ScPyjdhTnLhOsGGw.text: Love this place and turned on several of my friends to it as well.   Lunch special is just the right size for me but have done the AYCE sushi as well.  Haven't had a single bad meal there.

CQJa0ZDlv4QVow4X8xf11w.text: I wanted to eat Ramen today, but the Ramen world is just so complicated.  I can't go to Monta anymore because the tall Japanese girl who works there figured out who I am and she has been treating me real bad since I posted that bad review about the place.  I can't go to Shuseki anymore because it turns out the psycho old man from Ichiza eats there every night, and he is still pissed off at me because a few months ago  I made a very unflattering impersonation of him.  I don't want to go to Anime Ramen anymore because ever since Ryosuke went back to Japan, the service and food has been bad. I hope he comes back soon.  So, I was just about to go to Yagyu for Ramen when I remembered that SUSHI TWISTER is owned by the same dude who owns RAMEN SORA. So in my head I was like: "Maybe Sushi Twister will have Miso Ramen since they are owned by the Sora people!". The very thought of me eating AYCE Sushi and Sapporo Style Ramen at the same time overstimulated my brain. I was very disappointed when I arrived at TWISTER to see no Ramen on the menu. But, after ordering two pieces of Nigiri and having a great conversation with the Japanese sushi chefs, my disappointment left instantly.   This place actually has AYCE TORO! I have NEVER seen that before. But according to one of the workers, the AYCE TORO is like a random promotion. Some days when you show up they will have it, but most days they won't have it. So coming here for the AYCE TORO special is like gambling.   The Tuna nigiri has the highest quality Tuna I have seen in years. It wasn't even Toro but it had that fatty marbling. The fish was so shinny that the light reflected off it like a shard of glass. The Tuna literally just instantly melts inside your mouth.   The Eel Sauce with my Unagi was very strong. I don't know how they get the sauce to have that certain kind of deepness.   I love places that make their own tempura sauce. Places that use that generic bottled stuff suck. SUSHI TWISTER has possibly the best Tempura sauce I have ever had.   They got the best Sushi Rice on the face of the earth. It's seasoned perfectly! Many people don't have the sophistication to notice small details like that, but because I am so awesome I can.  My personal favorite "Ichiro Mashita" roll is the Dead Dragon. You should try it!   I also want to point out that this is the only AYCE Sushi place I have ever been to that puts wasabi in the nigri. Other AYCE Sushi places don't do this because they market their restaurant towards "westerners".   I am actually really happy that I came here today. I had a very entertaining conversation with the a chef named Hiro. And all the workers were really great to me.   When it comes to AYCE Sushi, Goyemon can't touch this place. Also, I rather come to small independent places like SUSHI TWISTER or SUSHI ON RAINBOW any day over one of Martin Kollefs multi-million dollar bankrolled hipster/douchebag sushi orgy places.  UPDATE OCT- I've lowered the rating from 5 stars to 4 because one of the sushi chefs accused me of being "HOOTO". When I told him that I didn't know what that was, he began to describe the person. Eventually I figured out that he meant Hootie B.... I was like: Are you f*cking joking? Do I look like a middle aged man with a Korean wife? Apparently, he thought I was "Hooto" because I told him about how most people on Yelp want to kill me. Don't get me wrong. I am a big fan of Hooto reviews and his Sysco comments always have me rolling on the floor laughing, but how the hell do you confuse me as him?

IlSHqC5jE3K6rvSaKQVhPQ.text: Ok so first of all let me start off with this place gets super packed, people standing outside type of packed. Our wait time wasn't so bad so we stayed. The food was good and fresh but the customer service was shit! We had plates stacked up next to us waiting to be taken off the table, the only reason we even came here was because we just so happen to be on the east side so this place was convenient at the moment but my boyfriend and I will probably never come here again

4-Hk0Z7WYxa6ECRaHlte7g.text: This place is so damn good.. they have actual Japanese sushi chefs every now and then which I was pleased to find out last time I came here.   First time having the chef actually put wasabi on the nigiri at an AYCE place. I remember they usally dont here, but I ate at the bar and I think the chef knew I was a sushi snob since I was ordering only nigiri and not just basic tuna and salmon every time like most people around me were getting.  The Ikura is by far my favorite here, its just really fresh and the nori is always fresh and super crispy.  The service was great, and the girl there actually noticed I come here pretty often and gave me a stamp card for a free ayce on my 12th ayce. That was a nice gesture so thanks to her Ill be coming back asap, even though they owe me like 4 stamps in reality.

c29ORRCCCMV7l2LpUx9bPA.text: Worst sushi place in town. Staff is rude. Just a very bad experience. I'll never eat here again. The quality of food was very bad not to mention the wait staff was worse than that of a fast food place.

k5rdUl8jgKC8AIdu9JtS8g.text: When we come to this place we order the chicken teriyaki plate or the beef plate. Comes with california roll rice meat and shrimp and vegetable tempura. Oh and miso soup and a green salad on the plate.  Good taste food. And if your a big sushi eater they have all you can eat too.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef teriyaki plate

4spFgJx9iLh8i1py4Au5Vg.text: I was craving Sushi so my sweetheart said lets go have sushi so we decided to go to Sushi Twister since he has been before. We usually go to Oyshi Sushi on our side of town which never disappoints with the good quality and service.  We decided on the AYCE so we could get our fill of sushi in to satisfy our cravings.  My man had been craving a roll they have that is wrapped in a jalapeno wrapper and deep fried that he always talks about being so good. Well he orders it which is now listed on the appetizer section of the menu and it was not anything like he remembered. The way he described it and the way it tasted was nothing like he had described or had before. The size was tiny not a full sized roll as before, so that was a let down and it was so small I could not even sample it.  Here are some of the rolls that we ordered,  boulder crunchy roll spider roll screaming for vengeance roll ecstasy roll shrimp tempura roll Philadelphia roll dead dragon roll angry ninja roll  For some reason the cucumber in my rolls caused a burned taste as if it was char broiled or blackened so I asked them to omit any cucumber from my future rolls.  The rolls were OK, nothing that gives me the oral mouth orgasm that Oyshi gives me on every visit. The flavor was just not there as I was expecting or had hoped for.  This was across town, quite a drive to try a sushi joint that I had never been to however we are spontaneous like that. My sweetheart said the Sushi was good in last visits however it seems they have changed and the rolls that he liked are just not what they once were.  OK so we gave it a shot and it disappointed unfortunately, and I am surprised because the reviews and star rating on Yelp are pretty good so?  I do have to say the service was very good, we sat at the bar and they had our rolls whipped up in a jiffy and they kept up on our drink refills!

V9e9YASzGxvUa2hOKNerGw.text: Excellent food. Bento plate was fantastic. Prices are frankly low for this quality. Service was good too. The real test how good the tempura was. It was perfect. Probably our new favorite Sushi restaurant in Vegas. Only five minutes from my house.

svNQ246yTipBg7h-xPPLIA.text: I absolutely love this place! Really, I do. Did I already say that?   I discovered this place on Yelp looking for a place that was open late. Plus, it is close to the hotel that I frequent while I'm on business.   The nigiri here is top notch, I have yet to order something that I was not happy with. The quality is fresh, the service is always amazing and quick. The place is small and so when it is busy, you may have to wait for a table. When there is a wait, I will order the seafood salad and it is just SO good! I can eat that everyday!   The place is right next to a Starbucks and across the street from a gas station, not quite what you would expect. Ample parking and easy to get to.   I probably order take out from this place 3-4 times a week while I'm in town - it's that good! I don't always do the AYCE only because I don't have the time, but when I do, I do! I love the fact that they have half rolls because you get to try everything!

J-t51Ra4dRF5JIOzWhAcwQ.text: I love sushi so much. I been in different place just for sushi but Sushi Twister last time i been here the service is good. The food not so much good feels like cmon sushi only no taste and also the price are over price for all you can eat. This is last time i'll go here. I'll rather go YAMA SUSHI way better taste and way better service.

UrcDtw6sQGNNsR0B9Uu38Q.text: This has been a consistently awesome eatery for years.  I have probably eaten here 30 or 40 times in the last 10 years and have yet to have anything to complain about.  The owners are very nice people and still work here.  I think I have always had the all you can eat lunch special.  The miso soup usually arrives in a minute or two after ordering.  I like the call a doctor roll that is shown as spicy level 5 but really it has the habanero and jalapeno sauce on the side so you can control the heat. The salmon love lemon roll is also a favorite item. The nigiri is always flawless with just the right amount of wasabi. I have tried a lot if sushi restaurants in this town and have not encountered the consistent goodness of Sushi Twister.

gt6ZNeTnnqOGcapf1n2v3Q.text: I Love this Place.... it's Small yet cozy,the Food is Amazing!! It's My Go to Sushi Place. It's not in the a Greatest Area of town but it is definitely worth it....  Sake.... Sushi..... and Lots of happy times here!!!

9pIJtW3LedGkB0t5DmwH_w.text: Auntie Em, Auntie Em! It's a twister! It's a twister!!  I've been hearing a lot of people say to me that Sushi Twister makes some of the best sushi in town. Well,not quite. But, Sushi Twister is making some good sushi over on the east side of Vegas.   First, for those living on the east side near boulder highway and Trop, and around that area, this might be your only option for AYCE sushi. And, it's not really such a bad option.  After walking in and sitting down at the bar, I was later told by the sushi chef that  Sushi Twister is owned by the same people that own Ramen Sora in Chinatown. I was expecting a lot, and I think that they delivered nicely.  Ordered too much to analyse bit by bit, but will try to give an overall impression. I thought the fish and seafood quality was good, but not great. I also thought that the rice was a tad bit on the slightly sour side. I also thought that their signature sauce that they put on many of the apps and nigiri, sort of a yuzu-type soy sauce, was too sour as well. As for the apps, I really liked the chicken karage, it was crispy, well seasoned, and cooked very nicely.  So, I like this spot, but it's a drive from me so i'll stick to my favoritos. But, for those that live in the area, this is a super solid option for those who don't wanna travel to Spring Mtn. Rd., but would still like some quality sushi.

oapVO1o48FyODifhVFkUjA.text: I've created a monster!  Ask my husband what his favorite food is and he will immediately tell you SUSHI; hands down!  When we moved back to Las Vegas 2 years ago we did not know where to go in Henderson. When we lived out here the first time, we had a favorite place over on N. Rancho but we moved to Henderson this time. While visiting the Albertson's (in the same parking lot as Sushi Twister, my husband saw this place and we decided to try it. 2 years later we are still enjoying this place and visit them at least 1-2 times a month (sometimes more).  Everything is fresh. Their Screaming O is to die for, their Spicy Tuna rolls are delicious, and their Japanese Lasagna is even better! Best place to eat sushi over on our side of town. The service is alright, could be improved a little it but nothing that needs a lot of complaining about. Even though we have visited them more than 50 times, they still ask us if we want the AYCE sushi and if we say yes, they tell us their "rules". Yes, Yes, trust me, I know them already.. but hey, they are doing their job.  The place is small and gets really busy on Fridays and Saturdays but it's cozy and quaint. The decor is good as well. We always sit at the bar because we like the interaction with the Sushi chefs and I like to see them make my sushi (I find it fascinating).  We will continue to visit Sushi Twister and we recommend them to anyone who says they like sushi.

TzUT7uCklzZh5NCao03bmQ.text: Service amazing & food is amazing! They're very attentive, fast, and informative. Their rolls are freshhh and delicious! & I totally go back very often!

Ez0BIeuqNko9Sv21vryVRw.text: The atmosphere was good and the restaurant looked clean.  The staff was pleasant and attentive.  The menu selection was good with all of the normal items for AYCE and a good selection of unique rolls and appetizers.  Food was delivered quickly when ordered.  I am only rating this as 2 stars because the quality of the fish from my experience was lower quality than what I expect from a sushi restaurant.  There were a couple of pieces of tuna and salmon that I didn't want to eat because it didn't look fresh.  We also had issues with one of our rolls falling apart.

eIaRkrRkLZD4E3fzRKjDmQ.text: Been coming for years awesome selection and ayce rocks!!   All rolls and appetizers are included with the all you can eat price. Service is great, very friendly.   Get a stamp card, you'll be back!!

JSF5YMtuxlRW9uo-PkagVQ.text: Came about 11:45 for lunch. The customer service is great. That's the reason I have it 3 stars instead of 2. We were greeted nicely and the servers were smiley and on the ball. But the food was just "ehhhh". We literally ordered every appetizer, and it was just ok. Not a lot of flavor. The mussels and the adashi tofu were good. That's about it. Good price on drinks. Although the service was good, we will not be returning because the food wasn't that great. Nothing special with the rolls too, just your everyday rolls.

8KJsM77YU9F6Ck0vjGwMiQ.text: I thought I was addicted to Sushi Mon  I cheated and went here because it is closer to my apartment.  Addict. So good.   That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vhiLInR4q7zFT4H0JupEeg.text: This place is BOMB! It's been a favorite of ours for years. The service is great and the sushi is better. However, do not be caught sharing all you can eat. Lol they see everything.

ZAUfZseGS5K9tJXahKj93g.text: The best mothers insist on taking their son out to eat, and what not to be the best of sons than to accept, right?! So I did just that;)  One thing i noticed right off the bat, was how spacious this spot was in compared to other Sushi joints. Of course you had the choice from booths, tables, or the bar.  The waitress taking care of us that afternoon was Wendy, who was very friendly and not to mention on point with our refills and additional orders. +1 For my technique of proper rating, i made sure to have one bite of each roll and cleared my pallet with a swish of sprite. Starting off with the Ninja, it was a solid 7.  Yellow Mango w/ Shrimp roll was a fresh change, although would taste better if they added some rice vinegar to it. 7  Spider Man had a lot of flavor hidden behind the deep fried mini crab legs. 8 And the Alaskan Summer was really great at the beginning although after the third bite, became really fishy. 8.5 Their Mochi ice cream here is limited to 1 per customer and only serve the two flavors of mango and strawberry.   In comparison to their competitors, their fourth star didnt come from the food, but having such an evenly spaced out, clean, and comfortable dining area.  Yes! Another sushi joint down in my books. Still looking for that 5 star though! ;)

7ewrKauJzH_idblx7tB6Ow.text: I ordered food through Uber eats and added that I needed silverware and soy sauce JUST IN CASE they forgot. When the food arrived there was JUST the food. No napkins. No soy sauce. No utensils. So I called the restaurant to find a solution and was left on hold for 10 minutes while the woman who answered the phone tried to find a manager. Needless to say she didn't have an answer for me and was not able to find a solution. I didn't get to eat my food that evening as I was in a hotel and they did not have silverware to offer me either. 5TbZ99VJIcsTfrU1yQxOQg.text: My favorite sushi place when I come in to town! Clean, & always busy. Sushi is always so fresh!

3pFd8iJ4i5HKZ1XULqG5zg.text: I guess a review update is overdue after 3.5 years.  Sushi Twister is a very convenient all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant because I live so close to it, but it hasn't ever impressed me enough to avoid the long drives to my favorite AYCE sushi spots. It's next to Starbucks and is near the 7-Eleven gas station on Boulder and Tropicana. One of my friends wanted to eat here last night, and I agreed since I most likely haven't been back here in over a year.  The appetizers are pretty good. Aurora shrimp are fried and breaded shrimp with a mayo-based sauce, and they really hit the spot if you're into that sort of thing. Their version of baked mussels either has little or none of the creamy sauce, but instead draw flavor from a dark sweet sauce. The sea eel tempura, which I don't recall trying before, is tasty and has the eel flavor but without as much of the typical sweetness of eel sauce. The tuna poke could've used more tuna but was otherwise a decent rendition. The screaming orgasm was delicious and had extra crunch from the tobiko (flying fish roe) mixed into the ubiquitous sauce.  The nigiri options are solid, although I'm always disappointed that super white tuna is not a standard option. It did make an appearance last night a special, and it did taste nice in spite of being topped with a sauce. I wasn't able to try it prepared sauceless because they ran out, which wasn't that shocking since it was late. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the limited nigiri options were. The sweet shrimp were flavorful and didn't feel mushy (and the fried heads were also nice), and the uni was above average for AYCE. While it wasn't the best that I've tasted on an AYCE menu, it wasn't discolored and didn't have any off-putting flavors. I only recall tasting salmon and tako among the other nigiri options, and both were also good.  I didn't have that much room left, so I kept myself to half rolls. I had to get my "namesake" Chris roll, which is shrimp tempura with eel on top. It was as good as I'd remembered. Sadly, I failed at reading comprehension and didn't enjoy my remaining choices. Mind you, they weren't bad in and of themselves, but the Cowgirl was entirely vegetarian inside and only had some seared beef on top, and the baked roll Alaskan Summer was not the best meal-ending option for me because it has a spicy yum yum sauce, rather than a standard yum yum sauce.  One reason that I've avoided returning is the limit of one dessert per person, and that hasn't changed. The mango mochi was an easy choice, and it's the standard mochi that you'll find anywhere. It was yummy, but I prefer having several desserts with AYCE sushi.  I was happy with the flavor and quality (AYCE-wise) of all of my orders, so perhaps I'll be back to Sushi Twister more often than once a year. It's quite a solid restaurant, but for those who don't live nearby, it's not destination-worthy. I'd only recommend it if you're exploring all that Vegas has to offer or if you've somehow tired of all the other places.

hwyxkgywbg187JK4bE0N4w.text: Sushi Twister is pretty much my go-to Sushi restaurant. The restaurant itself is pretty average, but the sushi is always on-point. When you get the AYCE (which is the only way I've ever ordered it), your appetizers come out pretty quick and hot (when it's supposed to be hot). They also don't make you wait too long between rounds of stuffing your face with the last roll you ate. My favorite is the 'Boulder Crunchy', 'Call a Doctor vs. Friday the 13th', 'Angry Ninja' and of course all of the Nigiri Rolls. 'Hot Shrimp' is my favorite appetizer.   Where do they come up with those names? Your guess is good as mine.  Oh, they also have a punch card giving your 12 All You Can Eat for free. You just have to use it within one year. Easy to go to this place once a month.   Like I said, the restaurant and decor is alright. Nothing to write home about, but it is always clean. MOoiyT-RztalEvbs4GAfHQ.text: This place is great! I was kinda skeptical because of the location but it turned out to be one of best AYCE sushi places in town. Orders come out fast for how busy it usually is. They have a big menu so order half rolls if you want to try a bunch of different rolls. The ahi poke is a really good starter. Don't forget to get a stamp card if you plan on going back.

kinGakanfwzgFsjEhaJbxQ.text: Excellent service, great tasting and fresh fish for a good price!  I recommend this to everyone to try!

efMt6FcI92JUkPIQgrRQ9g.text: We are sushi twister regulars. This is one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas. We usually don't go anywhere else.   I usually do the AYCE. I love the nigiri. Yellowtail, tuna, garlic tuna, salmon, eel, shrimp, white tuna and twister scallop.   AYCE includes hot and cold appetizers, full or half rolls (you choose) and dessert. Make sure to get a stamp card!   Must tries: Screaming Orgasm, Japanese lasagna, kill samurai.  My wife usually does the chicken dinner. It's a great a great value for the size. Comes with veggie and shrimp tempura, salad, rice, miso, California roll (you can upgrade to any other roll), miso, and of course Teri chicken.

QFptrjT0rLijW0KZiv3gxg.text: It's just A-OK in terms of service. However, at the end of the day my heart tells me that I have to say: Yay! I'm a fan.  I've been going to this place for a long, long, time. Years in fact. But like like all things, change is constant and Sushi Twister is not immune,   While the food is always good, it's the service that has slowly become an issue. The primary reason for this, as I see it, is that they've simply outgrown their space. The place is too small. They need to expand (which is difficult given that they are on a shared pad with Starbucks with nowhere else to grow) or just plain move. I suppose moving would be a bad idea considering that they have a lock in this area as the only sushi place until you travel all the way down to Topaz and Tropicana or so.    Regardless, the place is simply too small. When it's busy, which is almost always nowadays, people are literally sitting on top of each other. In fact, I would almost call it communal seating. On my last visit I had a couple to my right that looked to be on their first date (I think they really hit it off!!) and a couple to my left that were an established pair. She was a straight shooter. He liked to tap his feet and hop up and down a little in his chair when the next plate of sushi showed up (he looked to be about 50 years old). He'd even hum a little ditty while he ate. Perhaps he did this for our mutual pleasure? I would have to assume so given that our shoulders were less than a foot apart.  The staff seems to be overcrowded, overworked and overwhelmed. They aren't nearly as chipper as they used to be. This might have to do with the lack of space and over capacity. Or perhaps it's something else. It might be that they've become so busy that a customers business is no longer appreciated, but expected? This is a mindset that seems to occur from time to time when an establishment become wildly popular.   Purely speculation of course and I certainly hope I'm wrong. Overall the place is awesome and the food is fantastic. If they can work out these couple of kinks they'll be back to old form in a jiffy.

Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious! Sadly, I can&#39;t remember the name of this piece.

4TRSGPWDO5fs96fVVv6pSA.text: The AYCE is very fairly priced and the sushi is absolutely delicious, though you're limited to an hour.  There are many interesting choices, not always the same old options.  What astounded me is that they allowed us to order Uni as a choice, though only permitted 2 orders for 2 people.  It was creamy and just luxurious!  Rolls were good, but fell apart easily.  The seafood salad also looked and smelled fresh and delicious.  Everything we had was good except the Japanese salsa.  So unless you like a sour taste, stay away from anything with that on it.

YfxdpKa12BkyEsA-7Iue6w.text: So far our favorite spot for sushi.  We've tried so many different places yet we find ourselves only wanting to come back to this one.  It's $26.95 for dinner and I believe $22.95 for lunch.  It's a little bit of a drive if you don't live on the East side of town but hot d*mn it's worth it!  The cool thing is that if you're into sports, sometimes they'll be playing basketball or football games on their projector.  If I had to dock them any points, however, it would only be for the amount of times you would have to eat there before you receive a free "AYCE" which is 12x.  I wish it were only 10 at the most.  For the record, we've already earned 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Ninja&#34; roll.
Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Rum Jungle&#34; and &#34;Oh My God&#34; roll.

Xk2NTFEtAv6XoIvHqJZqcA.text: i come here when im on the eastside of town and i believe this place is really underrated. They are great as far as service, food is also good and the prices are awesome. Only thing i will say is that the fish needs a little work. i believe a better quality fish could help this place shine. the sauces they use are also great and roll selection is good. dont pass this up because i think like most restaurants  serve their best qualities of fish on friday so ill try it then and maybe my review will change since i did come in on sunday.

0iqWeAwLv4ZUragUdq8erQ.text: It was nice to find this local gem while stopping by in Vegas. I did the AYCE, which was about 22.50 for lunch and 26 for dinner. Totally worth it.. Filled up upon rolls and rolls and rolls and Nigiri. All the fish was fresh and the selection of different rolls were great as well. I also liked how you were able to order half rolls, this especially helps you are eating by yourself.  Don't forget, free mochi ice cream at the end. Absolutely delicious way to end the meal. 4 Stars, Highly recommended.

UMKv3Tna3-363c4og_QZeA.text: Decided to get the 2 person platter because of a review on here. Oh my wow! What a lot of food for so little! Including our drinks and mochi I had to be helped to my car! Could hardly finish what we ordered but were so very satisfied with everything. :) I was a pickup so I got to see only a small taste of the establishment but it felt very at home and authentic with the waiters interacting with guests at the bar, yelling out when I tipped, it was a great experience. :)

RRKVVevJLUyjZpFn33FOiA.text: I got the lunch special that day and I was one happy lady. A heaping bowl of rice with a good portion of teriyaki chicken plus a side salad, miso soup, and a hand roll, all for under $7 - mind-blown. You can't get good food like that for that price in Hawaii, so this is must while in Vegas!

uHQqdIr1AAHo620NbggRVw.text: Super fast service and yummy food. They always can get you seated quickly  and the house green salad is delicious!

-UErptaG5r6pmcQGTfVyng.text: Go to place on the eastside, i always sit at the bar. The sushi chefs always talk to us and staff always attentive. Oh my god roll is a must! I've never had a bad experience there..and water refills when i dont even ask for one

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh my god and spiderman roll

UUT6ApRDysqETOnl12AJzg.text: Best sushi place is town. I have been to several sushi places here in Vegas and this is the one I keep coming back too. My favorite is the Caterpillar Roll but that's just me. They serve flavored Sake (Raspberry and Apple) which I've come to see is not common.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tamago and Salmon Nigiri

bsYlbTlK3UDekGr1FP6dYA.text: I hadn't been to this place for a few years due to living in Japan, so I was quite happy when I returned stateside and found myself moving into a place just down the street...proximity to good sushi is an important aspect of living a full and happy life to me, man. The quality has remained excellent, some of the chefs are extremely pleasant and the rest are still efficient, amicable enough fellows albeit more focused on creating the sushi at hand. All of the servers have been quite friendly and cheerful enough, so we've always felt welcomed when dining here. If you order the amaebi they may offer you the deep fried heads as well- I for one fully suggest consuming those crunchy little craniums, they're delicious! Their screaming orgasm wiz a twist is, naturally, tastegasmic, though if I'm going to be totally earnest I'm enamored with any dish that combines thin shreds of crunchy daikon with a savory soy and mayo sauce. Their baked mussels are fabulous, as is their sea eel tempura. The quality and flavor of the uni and ikura have yet to fail me, and their octopus and hokki are consistently fresh with appealing and appropriate mouthfeel. My boyfriend is quite fond of their ika tempura, which has a sweet chili sauce, while I very much enjoy their seaweed salad.   Yummy, consistently fresh food in a welcoming environment in an unexpected location.  They offer happy hour deals where some of their more popular menu items are available ala carte at discounted prices.   You can also opt for a LARGE beer, in a glass that's at least 10" tall!  Gochisousama deshita!

KscmgCv5zBd6qKJmGa4zqQ.text: I went here again with my boyfriend a couple weeks ago. Waitress is very nice. We ordered a roll with mango. No taste, extremely bland. We ordered the first round of nigiri, it had no Wasabi in it. Then when we ordered the second round, they put Wasabi underneath the fish and rice like the traditional way. Then the third round, no wasabi. Kinda weird. Tuna was try, Hamachi was slimey.  Everything was bland or tasted like sushi I could get at Smiths. There were also bugs on the wall and trash on the floor. I mean, it's right across the street from Crack castle. What did I expect, really.  I'll stick to blue fin when I'm on the east side.

zhQujcCicfWgMl-cWxt8rg.text: The sushi restaurant is a great place to eat if you're on this side of town. This place has a variety of food not just sushi for those of you who have people who do not eat raw fish. The atmosphere is small an intimate. And they have a sushi bar at the front of the restaurant which is great the reason why I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 stars is because the seating is so close to each other you are pretty much part of another without realizing it. This should buy at the Starbucks or the smoke shop next door and expand their restaurant just my personal opinion

C1ue4jj8lvE9XRWSSZZgdQ.text: Jillsa and Yamasaki took care of our sushi needs! Both are recommended to the fullest. They are here dinner time off mon and tues....see you soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firecracker and behind that is the Japanese lasagna. Yummy!!!

zYXm2rmZdPp43ZH3wGp-EA.text: There baked Alaskan summer is a fav. And the rum jungle roll is quite devine. And there saba Nigeria is pretty tasty if I do say so myself. I've been coming here for years and will continue to as long as I live in vegas! Anyone wish g to have sushi come here it won't let you down!!!

fN1RwR6Tdg3c1Gccx2TxGQ.text: I frequently have sushi cravings and I will never ever come here again. The rice portions are like mountains. You know what nevermind, I'm going to bump this down to two stars because the only reason to come eat here is to see Yumi the boss. The quality of the sushi is so so as well. I usually order salmon and super white tuna at my favorite restaurants. The salmon quality was about 6/10 and they DIDNT HAVE SUPER WHITE TUNA. Goodbye sushi twister.

ddkSIg-btVq7R3iZw1x-vg.text: Love this place.  Authentic.  Customer friendly.  Glad you're in the neighborhood!  Good food.  My go-to neighborhood Sushi restaurant.

cJvnuH79C_64PvW9EoRQLQ.text: First time there and I was blown away by the food and low price. Recommend and I'll be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing place!  Great low price and the food hit the spot.

KTjTvLNBfxLErqiyoVha_g.text: I love that this place is away from the strip so you don't get a lot of tourists. This has been my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas for over 4 years.   The nigiri is the freshest in the valley. The sushi chefs take pride in their cuts so they cut from the meat when you order and they're not sloppily prepped earlier in the day. You can even see sushi rice prepped through the day.  This sushi rice is perfect. Not soggy or overcooked like other sushi places.   Service is always consistent. Servers are nice and attentive.   While I don't spend my time on specialty rolls, they are worth getting also. I particularly like the tiger yamazaki and spider man.

cyBMV5TfpHTfiuGHNPc7cA.text: Went for  the first time today. If the food is bad, it sure fooled a lot of people because people kept coming and coming and eating lots. We had the AYCE and it worked out great because most of the rolls can be ordered as a "half" roll and it allows you to try more different orders. We did notice that each item had its own taste. Sometimes when eating sushi, everything ends up tasting the same. Chefs were great but had to remind the waitresses several times about things ordered thru them (. Eg: soup, salad, drinks) not a big issue!  It reminds me of the small eateries that you would find outside of the city. Like those small family places that you find In the country or provinces. Like Arnold said, I'LL BE BACK!  May 12, 2017 Returned here last week ( and many times in between 2015 and now). I still love it and it still remains to be fresh, tasty and reasonable. Go check it out, im sure you'll enjoy too!

9K-RdiuGME-DzRqDwg0vPA.text: Love this place! Clean and lively. It's not Nobu.. but neither is the price tag!  I've had better sushi but not often and not for the price. The staff is friendly and the service is always great.

b-FlRxOWAe7zUhC7hu0Xtw.text: This use to be our go to sushi hangout. The service is great. When the staff makes you feel like V.I.P., it's one of the best feelings ever. I recommend this place to anyone that is looking for a good place to eat. I love going to places that have Uni (sea urchin), Ikura (salmon egg), Hamachi Kama (fried yellowtail) and oysters (raw or deep fried). I am not a fan of eel but my son loves it. Cream cheese is favored by my boyfriend. We enjoy bringing friends and family for an enjoyable meal!

gXdtMj264CQn-BzDBKLCiQ.text: My favorite SUSHI place The service is great and it's very clean.  Love it Love it...

Qx2BGBCkUctyvhbTHGj9GA.text: This is my new favorite sushi spot. Angie took care of us. Very good quality for $26. Good presentation and I didn't feel like they were rushing me like other places.! Highly recommend it.!

tithi_827O1EtXblXLyRsw.text: Good price and service overall, the options for dinner was great as it had variety and the right amount for its value. The 6oz. A3hQEyX7dt1TfewuVBzmIQ.text: Looooove this sushi spot! My favorite thing to eat here is the angry ninja roll. I always ask for extra Japanese salsa and spicy mayo. So bomb!

Spm0A9fitVMVnzACrwm0_w.text: This place is a joke, they are not an all you can eat sushi place.  They limit you to 1 hour for dinner and only 45 minutes for lunch.  Each roll you order takes anywhere from 5 to 20 minutes to arrive at your table.  So for almost $30 a head your lucky if you get enough food to equal a snack.  Do yourself a favor and go to a real sushi place you will pay just as much and get better quality, better customer service, and a full stomach without the attitude from staff and owners that care nothing about repeat business.

X7qws_7oMgyaBe6AqnjHNA.text: Sushi Twister is definitely in my top 3 favorite sushi restaurants in Las Vegas plus it is down the street from my house. I use to always come for AYCE which was always so freaking good. Lately I order TOGO because I work all day and just want to eat sushi in bed. Hands down best service even for takeout food. The quality is still great and they go over everything before they bag it up. Love this place so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My beautiful sushi that I got ToGo.

Q9qEf7C9pB1C_-PCdzpkLA.text: It's like every time I come here someone messes up my order. I don't know if it's just my luck but literally every single time I come something happens here.  First off, it is loud in here which is fine I like the music. If the server can't hear what you want she needs to come closer to you and ask, or ask you to speak louder.   I have a normal sounding voice it's not low. I also always order the same thing which obviously isn't expected to be remembered but "I know" I've gotten my simple order messed up at least 3 times I've come here. Screaming for vengeance and angry ninja are two very different sushi's.. yes they're both spicy but seriously? How do you mess this up.  On another note, when you have a huge family and everyone gets all you can eat... it is expected that everyone can get all you can eat. And order whatever you want from the menu within the 60-90 min that you can eat right? We had all ordered our food, the food was good, it was gone within a couple minutes... the servers would never come around to take more orders of food, no beers, no drinks... I mean it's all you can eat right? Or is it all we can eat when they want?   Honestly I keep coming here because I really like the food, I just hope they stop messing up my orders.

HuDhIy50uaC_4Ys0ydnXfg.text: We were there last month and had the all you can eat sushi. Although you have to eat everything you order, or else you get charged, it wa as well worth it. Every piece of sushi was so good.

VRwkHLHmgbrrDn8yZhAfEQ.text: Never will go back here again. I asked a few questions about their menus pertaining to food allergies and they had very little knowledge. I asked for tamari and she thought I was talking about Mexican food ???? Waitress forgot our drinks for an hour and still charged us. Wine tasted like apple juice. Sushi was fair but it probably would of been way better somewhere else.

BSSDe3vHB-kb0giDdUA5Cg.text: I've come here a couple of times so far. I love their lunch special prices, but I'm not convinced about the quality.  The first time I got a bento box with teriyaki chicken, which was pretty decent. The second time I got a sushi trio bowl which was subpar. It just didn't taste very good.  I have been reading some of the reviews, and maybe I'm just ordering the wrong thing. I'm going to have to come back and try the sushi.  Update: I'm changing my review to 4 stars. The sushi rolls are pretty good. I'll be coming back, I just won't be getting the trio bowls.

MNyJihBF_-qel9cvxw7ikQ.text: Nothing short of wow, we ordered the chicken Combo. It's so delicious and everything is well prepared, clean and visually appealing. -L0Rpkdvo4Hy24DYp0Gn-A.text: I just bought Chicken Katsudon and Tempura Dinner and I paid $ 18.00 for both at around 5:30 pm March 5 ,the white lady gave me my order and open the box. Sdm_DKTl171TS-P2JxtHUg.text: Had been going to sushi mon for a while... Last experience there was not good. I had been hearing about sushi twister. Food was great! Staff was awesome! Must of been my lucky day that we got seated right away!! Really loved the Alaskan summer roll!! Biggest perk... Close to home!!

7VYZEubAKWMAdv1sygkf7Q.text: Mixed feelings about my experience at Sushi Twister. First off It's in a kind of seedy area.   Second, it's really small so there's always a wait and not really anywhere to stand.   The food was good but not great. They definitely have quality nigiri. The pieces are a nice size and fresh.   Our server was really nice.   But everything else was just OK. The gyoza was so-so. The seaweed on all of the rolls was very tough and hard to chew which I can't stand.   My friend even got a crunchy piece of seaweed it was so dry.   The dessert selection was really limited in comparison to other AYCE places.   I don't know if I'll bother driving 20 minutes back here again.

n5gMGr786xSbJlkpCGidbw.text: Definitely one of the top sushi places in town! It is located in a plaza on Tropicana and Boulder Highway, it's pretty far east compared to everything else I go to (which is usually somewhere on the west side of town).   Plain and simple, they have one of the top quality fish in town with very good cuts. I would have to say they are on par with sushi restaurants I go to in Japan. Nothing is precut beforehand, they cut as they go. The fish are cut to the right thickness, not thin by any means, and the rice is minimal.   Do be careful if you do not like wasabi, you must tell them to NOT put it in the sushi as they prepare it with a bit.   I eat the same thing over and over usually which is ikura, tamago, and masago. I do have the ama ebi, ebi, tako, and sometimes salmon. I have yet to be disappointed by anything here.   The AYCE is the typical prices you see around town about $27 for dinner at $22 for lunch. Completely worth it, even if you don't like sushi, you can choose from a wide range of appetizers that are delicious! They do have rolls but I go for the nigiri sushi and some appetizers.   The UNLV Japanese Student Association uses Sushi Twister when they host their sushi nights at UNLV to enrich students in the culture of Japan and such. It is a big hit and good advertisement for them.

9k_Yc29F9SZdF_-UDTGoKQ.text: I'm very particular about my sushi and so when my friend told me about this place I was skeptical as ..well... its on the complete opposite side of town as my usual sushi spots, but I sure am glad I gave it a try! The salmon was delicious and the sweet shrimp did not disappoint. Love it:) I'll be back for sure:))

L-j7dVerVlcFiRHk95KLOw.text: My friend introduced me to this place, and honestly it's worth the long drive from Mountain's Edge when I know that I will be eating fresh quality fish.   We did the AYCE, and it's totally worth the price! We added up how much we ate one night, and it was over $120, but with AYCE, it was only $60! That's half price people!  The halloween roll was super yummy. Spicy without being crazy mouth on fire spicy. The fresh salmon is buttery and soft. The seared tuna nigiri is also one of our favorites. The dynamite appetizer of baked scallops, onions and mushrooms is TO DIE FOR. Also the screaming orgasm of fresh raw fish chunks. Yum. My mouth is starting to water just thinking about the fish here.   Honestly I have been to SO MANY AYCE sushi places, including the famous Sushi Mon in Silverado Ranch. This place is better. If it was closer to my house, I would be here at least once a week.

3i0NovqU4LShiBsbJUB18w.text: We've been here twice for AYCE sushi.  They've been very positive experiences the price is fair and comparative to other AYCE in the valley  about 21 dollars for lunch and 25 for dinner. Our last visit was the most recent, before that was over a year ago but I remember being happy with the meal. I started with some Nigiri mackerel, red snapper, and seared tuna, all were fresh and tasty. I opted for the pan friend gyoza and mussels, they were both good. Had a buncha rolls, probably too many but that's AYCE right? I really liked the Spicy Ninja, and got a hand roll with Habanero and twister scallops very good!     I like Sushi Twister, good quality, fair price, friendly staff, and nice atmosphere.  Recommend if you're in the area.

fsHk4jLMDhs9iz9_L7d1-A.text: 4 of us were on a mission for AYCE sushi and a friend recommended we go to Sushi Twister.  Started-off ordering all the nigiri sushi we could think of, since we didn't want to get too full on ordering the rolls (too much rice).  The quality of the fish was good and the service from our sushi chef Takashi was excellent.  Once we felt we got our money's worth, we started ordering the rolls.  Needless to say by the time we left, you could have rolled us out.  Some of my favorites were the white tuna, garlic tuna, unagi, sake and hamachi.  The Cowgirl, Monkey Balls, Screaming For Vengeance and Twisted Scallop were some awesome rolls.  To be honest, everything we ordered was fresh and delicious.  A must try if you're near Boulder Highway and Tropicana.

_cUtRiDB9F4vAnRuDrGrOg.text: 5 stars for service. I'd give more if there was an option. 3.5 for food. But this IS based on a Togo order.  I've been really craving sushi lately and since my bf doesn't eat it, I need a close solid take out option. I've had 2 personal friends rave about it, so I ran in (in slippers) and grabbed a menu. I decided on the Boulder Crunchy, the 9-1-1, and the jalapeno popper. The 9-1-1 was my favorite. Jalapeno was my least, BUT it wasn't that I didn't enjoy it. Just not my style, spicy tuna/crab mix inside a jalapeno like a popper.  The woman who took care of me was SO SWEET. She seemed shocked that I tipped her. (Step your game up non Togo tippers)  Also I didn't know this was Ramen Sora's sister place. Now I really can't wait to check them out, and also return here for the AYCE option. I will also be getting more Togo rolls as well! PS took pics but they didn't do my food justice so I will post next time :)

GJofdcFTjNDCWYeeEQbLDA.text: Pros:  1. The staff are friendly and attentive. 2. The portions are just right considering the cost of each item.   3. The atmosphere is upbeat, and the restaurant is clean.  Cons: 1. The chicken & beef teriyaki options are absolutely drowning in teriyaki sauce.  It would be better (and cheaper for the business) if the chef would hold back on the sauce a bit and allow the patron to ask for more sauce if necessary. 2. The all-you-can-eat (AYCE) option is priced a little high (Lunch ~$23, Dinner ~$27), especially when you consider that the Bellagio buffet is only a couple dollars more.  The lunch price should probably be closer to $17-$19, and the dinner option somewhere around $23-$25 (at most).    Summary: The AYCE menu has additional rules you need to know, such as a time limit and "excess food" charges.  Since these rules can change, I won't waste time writing them all here, but before you order, be aware of these rules.  Also, you may need to adjust your ordering strategy if necessary, such as ordering a lot of food right away because there's a time limit, and since your items are freshly prepared, you don't want to waste time waiting for your food to arrive.    This place isn't cheap, but the quality and taste almost match the price.  I'm not convinced that this place is special enough to warrant a far commute, but if you're in the immediate area, I recommend a visit.

9v9BpsJoFCdPIYRtR-nkFw.text: Not much to said The Jap Women with the big eyes she always give a hard time when I order to Go she is right there to bug me and over charge me $$ am thinking stop going over there cuz this Jap women is like she have a personal vendetta with me.i maybe have to bring this to Yama or the owner.beside that the food is excellent I really like this place

iuAKTeQH6iYI3TfxhjIxEQ.text: I give this place five stars not only the service was good.  We had the owner as our server. Total bill for a family of 5 was just dirt cheap compared to other sushi restaurants where the bill was not worth the food but the food here was   spectacular!  Great atmosphere where you can enjoy ones company.

i8XjNfqMjs8K1PV6RvjgtQ.text: Some of the freshest, best tasting sushi I've had here. My husband got an inside tip from a co-worker that knows that the owner purchases the fish the day it's flown in, so it was worth the drive to try it out. Now that we've made the trip & know that the quality of the fish they serve is top-notch, we will not hesitate to go back. Wish it was just a tad bit closer to home but that's my "I don't want to get in my car & drive any further than I have to when it's 110 degrees" side coming out. I will suck it up though & make the drive b/c it's that good!   We've been twice now & both times we have loved everything we've tried. I should preface this by saying that I am not a huge fan of all the "fancy" rolls that have become so popular over the last decade or so. I'm an old-school sushi eater, I like the simplicity of Sashimi & Nigiri. I like to taste the fish. When it's all wrapped up in a roll covered in sauces & tempura crunch, it can be very hard to tell if you're even getting a fresh piece of fish & that worries me a bit!   The 1st time we went, I had a hankering for Salmon terriyaki & was not really in the mood for sushi. Maybe only the 2nd time in my life that has ever happened! I did order the Poki appetizer & it was AH-mazing. The salmon terriyaki was good although the sauce was way too thick & there was too much of it covering the fish. If I order it again, I will definitely ask them to go easy on the sauce! Hubby ordered the AYCE & from what I could tell, he enjoyed every roll he had.   This last time we both had the AYCE & I will probably only do that from now on. It's a great value even if you don't eat very much & you can choose from hot & cold appetizers as well as all the sushi choices. I ordered the Poki again along with some Nigiri orders & even a couple of the "fancy" rolls, mainly b/c I already knew that their fish was fresh. I liked the Angry Ninja & the Sushi twister roll the best. I think I could eat that Japanese salsa all by itself.. yum!    I was slightly disappointed that they don't have fresh wasabi. Most of the better Sushi restaurants I've been to have it available for an extra charge so I was surprised they didn't have it. I have developed quite the affinity for it & can't really eat the stuff made from a powder anymore. I hope they consider making it available in the future & would be happy to pay an extra dollar or 2 to have some for my sushi.   We will be bringing the kids next time. Sushi gets very expensive when we go out as a family but the AYCE deal will make it much more reasonable & they will be thrilled.. "anything we want?!"

DJtXx0yUXVw6IGPGYaJt6A.text: They made my bf eat the last piece of sushi or they charge him for leftover. What a threat lol! Food wasn't too bad but we are never coming back here again.

f64_E8F2thx3usYqxp1JXA.text: I come here once a week with my Mother on either a Saturday or Sunday for lunch. We usually get the Twister's Lunch Special, which gets me and my mom full and for 8 or 9 dollars it's really quite good.  The last couple of visits, we decided to have the AYCE sushi for lunch. for 23 or 24 dollars a person, it was A-OK. the menu they have here isn't so different from other Sushi places i've been to around Vegas excluding a small number of other special rolls. The quality is great and the taste is pretty good, but in my opinion not the best. Sometimes the rice is falling apart or not aligned correctly and evenly, that when i try to pick it up the rice slides out. Not too good but it doesn't really bother me too much.  The Service is good. Sometimes i have a feeling the waiter that serves us is in a rush and wants to get our order quickly so he can get on with another task. The Waitresses on the other hand are nice and keep a nice patient attitude which i prefer.  My mother and I will definitely go back as Sushi Twister is the closest Japanese Restaurant to us!

c2qhfeE2_dBkl2irEYHGYQ.text: Wasn't the best quality sushi, the fish was extremely dry and smelly. None of my orders seemed fresh at all and my cup of water even smelled horrible. My rice was pretty hard on some of the rolls and this was more than one experience. I tried it a second time with a friend that wanted to try it so I gave it another shot and same bad experience. I was so upset because I was recommended this place and I would NEVER recommend this sushi spot to anyone. The lady we ordered from was hard to understand and I was trying to be polite as possible but she was getting irritated that I couldn't understand and was rude when I would ask her to repeat herself because her accent was too strong for me to understand.

O7qY-NoxZX3_vJXqUDqWVQ.text: I'm a visiter from Los Angeles and there are a lot of sushi places to eat there, but this place is way better than the ones I have been to. My sister took us here and I'm not disappointed at all. Thick fresh pieces of fish and I couldn't get enough. We ate here 2 days in a row. Great food and great sushi can't ask for more.

QrRZy19FIWN5f_Pkrbjg2Q.text: Best sushi in las Vegas !!!!!! Call the doctor vs Friday the 13 is a killer super fresh the service is excellent and very clean

3fJvAaXsPciorT4yfHte4g.text: One of my regular go-to sushi places here in Vegas. The freshness and quality of the fish are consistent so I never worry about eating anything that's gone bad or too fishy tasting. Rolls are also great. There's a favorite that I get every visit, especially since I don't usually see it at other sushi places - the Cowgirl. It's a roll wrapped in seared beef, inside with cucumber and something else I can't remember, drizzled with sauce  - very good!   Like other sushi places here, they've got all you can eat as well as a la carte. Can't go wrong here.

W9ZeO0tvDY0CcGtwt3DAag.text: It took about 10 minutes to get my name put on the list even though I was the only one waiting. Then our luck that we got a waitress with a long face, it's not my fault you're having a bad day. Then she tells me in a rude tone that she'll have to charge me for my daughters outside food (they never have before) and so I asked how much and she yelled at me like I didn't hear her and said "FOR YOUR CHILDS FOOD" so once again I said how much are you going to charge me and she said 4 bucks. No thanks! I don't even want to keep on with this review cause of how pisses I am because of her rudeness.

WqkUk8NIMu61QrmugQOWeg.text: I saw this place on Yelp. They had good ratings and an all you can eat, so my family and I decided to give it a try. They must be good because when we got there there was a wait and a lot of people taking out.   When we got seated we were helped out right away. Our server took our drink orders and then our food order when we were ready. The food came at a reasonable time.   The only reason I knocked off one star from their rating is the fish to rice portion for the all you can eat. I normally like my sushi nigiri with more fish and less rice. Their so nigiri had more rice to fish. Another thing I like on their all you can eat is that you can place half orders for the rolls, which gives you a chance to try more rolls! But their octopus sushi nigiri was very tough and hard to eat.   Rating the other food my family got, they said the beef teriyaki was very tender and the chicken teriyaki was very flavorful. And the portion size of the combos were just right.

i2CxSyNDe-Zwqm4l2RM2LQ.text: Was craving some good tempura and my mom said this was the place so we went for lunch when I was in town visiting! I am a snob when it comes to proper tempura and they do it right, everything I had was excellent. Loved the vibe and enjoyed the food what more can you ask for?

hBgZQfrtkM436R3wwHfFeA.text: Horrible horrible customer service. It was a full house and there are only 2 servers. The sushi falls apart right after you've picked it up. They had forgotten our order and it took forever for them to bring it to us. They didn't even bother giving us any refills. Never coming back, this place was better 4 years ago. If management changed then they should review their staff. This is the worst sushi place I've been to in Vegas. The rice tasted disgusting and the fish didn't taste fresh.

Their all you can eat sushi buffet is amazing, for $27 you can't beat eating 10 sushi rolls. I have been a fan of this place since it first opened and I will continue to be. I also love the fact that you can now get it delivered via UberEATS, especially when I'm too lazy to get out of my pjs and leave my couch, but also want sushi to enjoy at the same time.

O4A5AwUt7YP4Z83-GYG3yw.text: I love this place!! The sushi is so good and fresh, but what I absolutely love about this place is their service!!! From the chef to all the servers they are all amazing. Check out the boulder crunchy roll and the Ai & Yuki

iyTjTmAg4G_hiqpXsOVYow.text: There aren't very many choices as far as sushi go on the east side of Vegas. Hidden in a slightly sketchy strip mall is Sushi Twister. Now don't be scared if someone hits you up for a cigarette or try to sell you fake flowers, but push beyond that to the sushi goodness!   I haven't done the ayce here, but my love is the sashimi plate. They have beautiful cuts of fish. I also love that they have a small and large option when it comes to the sashimi plates. For you ayce lovers they also will do half rolls!!  If you are looking for something to accompany your sushi I suggest the Dynamite. It has scallops coupled with mushrooms and beautifully caramelized onions that totally add a sweetness to the dish.  If you are looking to kick back a couple cocktails they do offer many beers. They are super reasonably priced.  I've had their house Plum Wine and their Plum champagne. I definitely prefer the champagne. It has a much lighter and fruitier taste. It does pair well with the sashimi in my opinion.   The staff! Omg nicest people ever. Plus, they definitely have a sense of humor. I've knocked over several of their plastic menu stands and they are always nice about it and joke with me. They are even kind to my father who tends to get messy with his soy sauce and wasabi mixing. Plus, their music selection is spot on!!!! Props on that. It's something that definitely sets the tone for a dining experience.  I think this place is spot on with everything I've tried! I look forward to trying more.

NhT7ya68rhaFSA2-vkh88Q.text: nothing bt the best service everytime were here .. they always know how to hit the spot. and not just with the g-spot or orgasm rolls . we will always stop here if we ever leave vegas and come back to visit . i tell all my customers to come here when they visit.

jFDx2nTj4R903ZUvAqkDmA.text: Sushi twister used to be my favorite sushi restaurant in all of Las Vegas, however the last two times I have gone I have been disappointed in the quality and freshness of the sushi rolls. Since I have been coming to this location for the past 8 + years. I used to come to sushi twister at least four times a month & loved the rewards card of earning a free all you can eat. I moved to the other side of town 3 years ago and don't always make it to East Las Vegas. This is my sons favorite place and since he has moved to North Dakota, when he comes to town he loves to have me take him to sushi twister. We will give them one more shot when he comes to Las Vegas next month and hope the food quality And freshness has improved.

vBb0tUZPAx7E3PfEYr6MqA.text: Bad experience!!!!!Dirty spoon with lipstick on it!!!! And after we ate they tell us no card cause their machine is broken, would be nice letting us know before eating so we didnt have to eat there!! And they wanted to write down our creditcard number or tell us to get go get cash! And they see we have kids with us! Ans its a 100 something degree outside! Bad experience! Bad service!!!sad coming from  the manager!!!

I8AkRC3PxY4RIlc8k5UiuA.text: I love sushi twister. The staff is always so sweet and attending. And of course the sushi is always on point.

nxBP7NbFonX_oRhuf25I_g.text: You wont get any other sushi that is better in this entire town, especially for this price. Been coming here for six years (and I'm 16) and I love it. Makes sure to get here early though, because it can get busy really quick during the rush times!  Even then it is still worth the wait. Just be careful about the area for that it is pretty sketchy at night. Lock up your cars tight! And get fat and full and happy inside

yfFWpXTS9k5xDCQllG2FVg.text: Decent service, the sushi was delicious!  My favorite was "Call the Doctor vs Friday the 13th" it's spicy and super yummy!!   Our server made sure my water glass was always full and tea was full, he didn't really add much more to the experience but he was nice, quiet and attentive.  The food is great, worth your money for AYCE.  My only complaint, is during the day the windows had no blinds and the sun was right in my face, also it's a very tiny space but that they cannot help.  Put up some blinds next time and I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Call the doctor vs Friday the 13th!! Best roll there if you like spicy!

E5T39twWy16VLeKnwEIEjw.text: So delicious!!!! Do the all you can eat. It's worth it!!  I'm so craving an angry ninja right now!!!

jfmH2opBt-zilxiLElmt2A.text: Sushi Twister was very disappointing. The sushi was bland. The eel sauce was terrible. I won't assume it's usually like this, but it tasted burnt and wrong. The spicy rolls had no spice or kick to them. Two people in our group ordered mango mochi, then they proceeded to put the orders in the same plate; this is not the best way to serve to separate people. Service was good, but for the price of $27 the food was overpriced. Slash it by $5 and it'll be worth it. Go to Kaya or Yama, they are cheaper and have better food.

zhaXQjHY7vfYR7Cm3qSdXQ.text: **Summary** - Sushi Rice - They use their own wooden sushi rice tub so their rice tastes a ton better than other places that just use a simple rice cooker. (yelp.com/biz_photos/MXC9...) - Freshness - Their salmon and ikura were especially fresh. - Special Daily Fish - They have daily fish specials like fatty tuna. However, the day we went, they ran out. - Service - Our chef was friendly and very quick. The place was packed so I understand why the waitresses were a bit laggy. **Price** - $21.95 Lunch Open - 4pm. - $26.95 Dinner 4pm - Close. **Ordered** - Monkey Ball - Spicy Tuna and Mushroom in a tempura ball. The mushroom overpowered the rest of the dish, but it was an interesting idea. - Aurora Shrimp - Fried shrimp with Japanese mayo on top. - Dynamite - Scallops, onion, mushroom, and imitation crab meat on a big half shell. One of the best Dynamites I've had. - Sushi-Twister - Shrimp Tempura and Tuna with Japanese Salsa (Ponzu sauce base with a spicy kick) - Oh My God - Yum Yum scallops, imitation crab, and soft shell crab with eel sauce. Heavier roll, but delicious. - Yellow Mango with Shrimp - Yellowtail, mango sauce, and shrimp. It was a light roll and the mango sauce added a sweet flavor. **Recommendations** - I'd definitely recommend this place. The fish is fresh, the rolls are inventive, and the appetizers are delcious. It's a no brainer.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wooden Sushi Rice Tub. Now that&#39;s authentic!

WZj2W3aA3S9rTnyXg2-3Mg.text: Kind of disappointed with take out sushi order recently.  Ordered the 44 piece nigiri sushi and roll plate to go, pieces were very small, about the size of a child's thumb.  Looked like the plate was made for children, rather than adults.  Always have had the bento box when eating in and it is the best.  Buyer beware, I wouldn't order any more takeout, only eat in from now on.

They have the best customer service and great food now i see why this is her favorite. Now this is one of my favorite Sushi restaurant  in vegas. I tell people about this place.

wdi0fLrUETIilNQ8eOMBvg.text: Amazing service!! Our server was josh. He was soooo tentative, always on it, asking if we needed anything and he had a lot of tables to serve too!! And they were so fast in getting out what we ordered! The specialty rolls were so different and the names were classic.."call a doctor vs. Friday the 13th". Too fun!!!!

I always get the Volcano roll just because it is my favorite but I also like trying a new roll everytime too.   Here are some of my faves....  Magic Mountain Rainbow Cowgirl and of course the namesake Sushi Twister  Stop by and enjoy some awesome fresh sushi!!
