teX37X0mbKL1YC3ehTU16w.text: Had AYCE for lunch with hubby today. Service was great. Sushi was good - especially the spicy rolls. We really liked the Angry Ninja and the Screaming for vengence. The spicy rolls were not too spicy and had flavor, not just heat. The seaweed salad wasn't so good though and we did not like the ecstacy sauce at all. I would definitely come back and will order the Angry Ninja again! I also wanted to mention that their plain iced tea was the really good - not too watered down.

aqo1Bwd5i1ugyxLPC0PXtg.text: Love this place! All you can eat, super fast service. Great customer service. We love Wendy! I have a 5 year old who is a super picky eater and would never eat sushi and they also serve French fries for kids! We thought that was awesome!

S8jzGY0k3ZzlythChc-9gA.text: Sushi, I'm sorry but I'm just not that into you.. Seaweed (yuck), raw fish (cringe), and huge bites at a time (gag).. but I digress..   My other half has a deep love for sushi (and most things Asian for that matter, haha) so I like to be a good sport and attend these all you can eat feeding frenzies whenever the suggestion is made; it's me compromising ;)   Not located in the greatest parts of town, we entered the somewhat warm establishment. We were greeted right away and sat with a quickness. The server took quite a while taking our drink order and didn't express much in the way of personality.   The music was quite eclectic, Asian techno, to indie music, to um..??? The decor was bland, much like the chicken dish I ordered but the cucumber salad was sort of redeeming really, how can you screw up cucumber salad anyway, right?   The other half enjoyed one roll (I forgot which one) out of (I lost count), several and stated that a return visit wouldn't necessary be in the cards. Not that the food or service was so terrible, but that there are plenty of other, "better" choices out there for sushi.   I give this joint 3-stars because it wasn't terrible and it was about as fantastic as an inexpensive sushi place could be to a non-sushi lover.   Best part: cucumber salad and price   Try it, or don't..whatevs ;)

MCEoSN6Omgzm14Iu-8sScw.text: I can only comment on their takeout lunch specials.  I usually get the seafood poki bowl.  It is an assorted dish of fish such as salmon and tuna on a bed of rice and seaweed.  The types of fish they put in your bowl may vary, but I've always noticed salmon was always in my order.   The portion is quite generous. Not bad for $8.38! I like the container it comes in. The presentation is pretty nice.  The beef lunch special is not bad either. It says on the menu it's a Kobe style filet mignon chip beef.  For $8.50 you can't go wrong.    Service is great.  The waitresses always let you check your food before they bag it up.  I have yet to try their AYCE!

6mcN29FOG1xaDJWNtYNwrw.text: Let's just say that I can eat here everyday during my trips to Vegas and I'd fly back to Hawaii completely satisfied. I am a tough critic when it comes to fish....whether it's raw or cooked, I can only eat it fresh. I will literally gag if I'm served previously frozen fish.  With that said, Sushi Twister is not only awesome for serving fresh fish, but the AYCE concept just blows my mind. How can they serve such great quality fish at such reasonable prices? I mean, $30 per person for AYCE sushi AND kitchen ala carte items?! What?  Anyway, everything I ate was good. I especially liked the toro, uni, and amaebi nigiri sushi. I'm not into maki sushi but the oh my god roll which consisted of scallops, crab, and yum yum sauce was really delicious. And the agedashi tofu and hamachi kama from the kitchen menu was cooked to perfection!  Service was great, ambience is perfect, and always a good time at Sushi Twister.

q_LPDfpfx1TD1TY05yLQjA.text: I was at Sam Boyd stadium last weekend (with Tom C., apparently - go NZ rugby!), and went to this place because of the Yelp rating. I just pulled in, ordered 2 rolls to go, and then left with the rolls. Took about 15-20 mins to get the rolls. They have a pretty extensive selection with a whole menu section for fried/tempura maki (it's not just AYCE). The place was hopping, very busy for mid afternoon. I got an Caterpillar (eel avocado) roll that was good, and something called a Matsuri roll, shrimp tempura with tuna on top. For the take-out, they separated the sauces in little containers, which is a nice thought but it was tricky to eat in the car that way. "Ecstasy sauce" (on many of the maki rolls, including Matsuri) is a bit of eel sauce mixed with spicy mayo and some kind of roe. Matsuri roll was good, better than the eel roll. You can find the sushi rolls on their Dinner Menu at sushitwister.com, and you can also find out that they use trans fat free tempura oil, "BEST OIL FOR YOU WHO CARE FOR YOUR HEALTH".

8R2VEFnQs4ggPyQXQ-Xs3w.text: Fantastic AYCE, been here many times since moving to vegas. My favorite sushi place by far.

SlMMkazGYwYUjQ8qNl1pEQ.text: Love this place and the staff!  Been coming here since it opened and love that they remember us, even if it has been awhile. Good food and great people!!

Nv2nW4HPOZqL8tSSqd7JEw.text: For the past few years we have loved this restaurant, however customer service has not been the best. Its time to find another sushi place. Not interested anymore. If the owner doesn't care about customer service why the sushi chefs care! BAD SERVICE!!

xXHwNLKjeU4emg5cz6UnUQ.text: My boyfriend and I have been trying to expand our sushi wings and explore new sushi places. We read a bunch of positive reviews about Sushi Twister here on Yelp and figured it was worth a try. It isn't anywhere near our house, but we figured good sushi was worth the drive...and it was!  We went with the All You Can Eat and sat at the sushi bar, which was a great choice. We didn't wait more than 2-3 minutes after ordering each roll. The service was excellent and timely, and they were packed.  Our favorite items included the albacore, garlic tuna, Kill Samurai, and Cowgirl. You can order 1/2 or full orders, which we loved. It allowed us to try more rolls without feeling too stuffed.  My only complaint would be the spicy rolls. They weren't as spicy as I would have preferred, but they were still delicious. I tried the Angry Ninja and Call a Doctor vs. Friday the 13th.  Overall, we had an excellent dining experience, and we will definitely be back!

RhO4B4FDzcPzNkjC28_eBA.text: The food was really good . Got a basic California and some green tea ice cream. The only reason they only get 3 stars is cause the customer service was terrible !! My friends decided to try a spicy tuna roll and they hated it which is not a big deal. But they wouldn't do anything about it, not even replace it with a regular California. So that was kind if dissappointing . Other than that the food was good. Don't come here expecting a1 customer service though!

-Lob2wcVkIJDeXHNc9izLg.text: Love this place.  You'd never would think that there is such a good sushi spot in such a ghetto area, but don't be fooled...there is!  Go there on the weekdays after 9pm for some killer happy hour specials that are listed on the center table card.  They have some amazing take out deals as well!  It's not my absolute favorite spot, but it's my everyday go to spot.   I wish they had better music.  That's for sure.  At the very least something traditional instead of elevator techno.

D1BryulN3vqTNYCmxkacXg.text: My husband and I have been coming here for the last couple of years, been to other places, but does not compare to Sushi Twister.  The staff and chefs are always friendly and the food is fresh and yummy.  The rolls are creative and unique.  We always do the all you can eat for dinner or monday night specials.  I have recommended to my friends and they still are coming back for more................

qdQYHI6H5ObK1T_2nOxpsA.text: Havent been here..YET. just wanted to add it. I did eat some of their sushi while at a picnic...and it was good. I'll go in there, and update this review soon.

Next time I visit I'd like to try AYCE menu. Definitely would recommend, also off the strip with lots of parking.

juZ1wpodznlgmZaSoM1mKA.text: SO GOOD. AYCE for 21+ tax (for lunch).  Fresh, quality sushi, tons of rolls, dessert! The options were endless.. and it was all GOOD. I really recommend yellowtail and hamachi. I wish there was a place like this in West LA.. Seriously, forget Todai..come here if you're ever in Vegas! UGH sushi cravings..!!

dkU-qSjvNA9AyDO_SPIPSQ.text: I really love coming here! I usually get a combination plate and a roll. Really awesome prices and portions that really fill you up! It's tasty. The staff usually greets you with a warm welcome. Definitely recommend if you want a casual place to meet a friend for lunch.

cxqkIvgLrDHT7_6dHs2Qeg.text: Sushi Twister has by far the best sushi in town, price is extremely reasonable considering that its all you can eat. The service there is awesome as well. I definitely give this place two thumbs up!!!

D4elzvHX_rXQ56Ywt_tiRg.text: Don't let the location of this place fool you. It's very good sushi. The all you can eat deal includes almost all of their rolls and such.

-_Io2s3KlT1RaMO2i5Ptnw.text: my favorite sushi place. nigiris are good and eveything is so delicious. the one thing i dont like is mussel. but alsakan summer is the best. i am coming here only for alaskan summer !!!!

33sPClkBbmyoUKCPDRCdfQ.text: Sushi is the type of food I can most comfortably say I frequent the most.  It almost seems like I am always trying to find the best sushi spots in Vegas and find out what they're all about.  Plus, I usually always target AYCE sushi joints because I am a big guy with a big appetite.  With that being said, whenever I prod anyone to come out and eat sushi with me I always hear the name "Sushi Twister" mentioned.  While there are a lot of people that rave about this place, I'm never quite in the same boat as they are.  Don't get me wrong.. the ambiance is great, the staff is friendly, and the location is awesome (about 15 minutes from my house and about 2 minutes away from my job) but the sushi doesn't cut it for me.  There are a few good rolls like the Freddy vs. Jason, Boulder Crunchy, and the Ecstasy roll but the majority of the rolls I didn't really find appealing.  I like the fact that they had low sodium soy sauce, good prices on Sake, and a giant screen projection for a movie or sporting event, but after going there a few times I'd rather stick to my usual hangouts.  On a side note, the chefs were pretty funny and just a tad bit obnoxious at times but that only added to the appeal of the Sushi Twister environment.  Not bad IMO but not enough to coax me back for another AYCE encounter with the "Twister".

MgSG_29YFkaNsst_eSCyBg.text: The food is amazing, me and my friends love going there for the all you can eat sushi. The only thing that I have a problem with this place is the poor cashier service. I am talking about the young latin chick in the front. Before her I use to love going there, now we have to go to  other places that we like but are very far away to go. But we would still make the drive to the other side of town rather than deal with her attitude and poor customer service. And I live right up the street from this place.  The waiters and cooks are great and very very friendly. If only they got rid of her it would be a much better place.

ShILLkCk8UZ3H5qJVC5bKA.text: Occasionally we order take out from here and get the ninja, spider, kill samurai, boulder crunch & tiger rolls and the salmon teriyaki dinner combo ONLY because its closer to home.  Generally we love to do AYCE and have tried a lot of them throughout the LV valley. So this time we decided to give Sushi Twister a try for AYCE since it was late and we didn't feel like driving too far.  The sushi was ok but none of which were fantastic; this time we also tried the Angry Ninja (new item) , ecstasy & Matsuri.  The place was very busy and at first the waitress seemed very nice but as the evening wore on, she forgot an order and wasn't as nice.. maybe it was because we had 3 toddlers with us. Well we were a party of 4 adults and 3 children all under 3yrs of age.  At the end of dinner, my husband gave his mochi ice cream to 2 of the toddlers and the waitress came over and yelled NO SHARING! you cannot share with the little kids!  My goodness that was just 1 little mochi ice cream ball and she made a big deal about it and embarrassed us at the restaurant.  Food wise we would rate them a 3 star because the sushi was ok but not outstanding.  The best place we love for AYCE or not is SIN SITY SUSHIi, I love Sushi is also very good but they do not offer AYCE.  We took off 1 star from our overall rating because we will not give this place our time or money anymore because of the incident with the mochi ice cream and also because they included the 3 kids in our party total and automatically added 18% gratuity.  I don't think this place is kid friendly.  From now on, I would rather spend my money on gas and drive 20 minutes for fresh and great tasting sushi as well as outstanding service other than Sushi Twister.

d47DlUsk0kd5grWHhmvycQ.text: Okay so I decided to give this place a try again and was going often again. Again the owner pissed me off. I was there for lunch one day and I sat at the bar in front of the owner. Everything was going fine until his friend showed up with his own fish. The owner started to cut his friends fish and setting up sashimi plates right in front of me and decided to completely ignore all my orders after. He started to give my orders to the guy next to him. It sucked I left with great disappointment. So I decided to never sit in front of him again like I told myself last time. I went in there with my family and wanted to sit at the bar. We waited for about an hour for a spot at the bar because it appeared that again the owner was serving his friend and somebody who appeared to be his brother. I have spend thousands of dollars at this place and I do not get treated well there. We still did not get to sit at the bar and that was it. I am never going there again... I left and found another all you can eat spot that night. Sin city sushi is off of Eastern in Henderson just south of the 215. To my surprise when I walked in. JIMBO!! the old owner of Mandas that use to be on Sahara :) If any of know sushi in Vegas that was one of the most popular spots in Vegas.  The service was outstanding unlike twister and I recommend that everybody that goes to twister to try this place it is so much better and the service is great!

x4OR69sQyo2dERviSBcGbw.text: What can I say about this place? It is DA BEST SUSHI in Vegas!!! I've tried so many places and no one compares to this place. I travel from Summerlin and its worth the long drive. Everyone I recommend this place to absolutely loves it.  Everything is fresh and tastes good. The AYC is a reasonable price. The servers are nice and food comes out fast. The stamp card is a good perk as well.

IPBXh7SzO31jDYdahGFfKw.text: A friend of mine has been raving about Sushi Twister, located on Tropicana just west of Boulder Hwy. He and his wife have been buying platters for $35 and claim it is way too much food for 2, or 3. Now I didn't get the platter as it was just me and my friend, but we did order a nice selection of sashimi and rolls.  Everything was well presented, and tasted great. The japanese lasagna (my personal favorite) was delicious, the dragon roll was a deep fried delight. The sashimi was pretty good, maybe not the best I've had. Overall I'd give the food 3.75 stars.  The service was very good. We were immediately seated, and fortunately it was just turning 5pm so the place wasn't too crowded (it did eventually fill up). Drink orders filled quickly, and after a couple of requests for more time, we put our order in and got our food back in about 10 minutes. Well done!   Overall, a good value and decent food. Excellent service including prompt water refills. I will come back again for sure!

VcTRpXTyl73Gu1wRMwkb3Q.text: My and my sister both got sick from eating here last night. Never again, be careful with this place. Super disappointed because it has such good reviews. Sushi was ok nothing special or worth coming back too.

PNSiZy89EbC11_TociHAmQ.text: 3.5 stars, rounding slightly down due to inconsistent service and quality. Came in for AYCE at a friend's recommendation. The fish is super fresh, and I recommend their nigiri. The older Japanese chef served it traditionally with wasabi and a light bit of soy sauce rather than just as fish and rice elsewhere. The freshness of the fish makes the nigiri their strongest point, and I'd stick to that on future visits.  About halfway through out visit, we were passed off to another younger chef who seemed to have difficulty keeping up with orders. We switched to rolls and they were packed with a disproportionate amount of rice. I am not the biggest fan of their rolls, and I finally put my finger on why: I did not care for their sauces. Some have a metallic taste to them, while others like the Japanese salsa are served so cold they are almost icy. Rolls without sauces, such as the Salmon Loves Lemon, were preferred.

nu9gkGuoykwEXuCRxd5qRA.text: Jumi or yumi the manager I think she was has horrible horrible horrible customer service. Very bad asset the the company. Good sushi but unfortunately due to the service I received will not be returning.

xcKUchCvrUgRuYc6dwYktg.text: All you can eat sushi for 25$? When my friend suggested it I had my doubts and could only image the cold hard sushi with paper thin slices of fish you get at the casino buffets, but no this place serves sushi that's fresh and delicious. We came from San Francisco and over there 2 rolls will set you back 30$ already, here the quality is on par if not better then those places and it's all you can eat! Highly recommend coming here.

02b6n5MnEzKX6f4Az7D1VA.text: My all-time favorite AYCE sushi restaurant. I have probably eaten here at least 100 times. You can order half and full rolls. Also, they have a stamp card and you get a free all you can eat after your 12th visit. So 13th visit is free.  FYI: All of my photos are poor quality because I basically ate most of the food first, then remembered to take a picture lol!   I enjoy their AYCE, to-go orders (like their sushi burritos), and lunch/dinner specials if I'm low on cash or want a quick, light meal.   Nigiri here is to die for: halibut, salmon, tuna (the salsa on top is amazing), eel, shrimp, white tuna, yellowtail, you name it.  My favorite rolls are: Angry Ninja, Ninja, Boulder Crunchy, OMG, Dragon, Mexican, 911, Spider-Man, Caterpillar, California (classic go-to). Appetizers I love: baked mussels, seaweed salad, shrimp tempura and veggie tempura (especially sweet potato).   The Crunchy Twister sushi burrito is sooooo yummy! To-go only though!   I just love Sushi Twister!

zN2pyTJeHj9srwStMAhMBQ.text: We live right up the road so this is always our go-to sushi place if we don't feel like driving to our favorite sushi place,  It gets the job done.  The service is always fast, the sushi is good.  Not my favorite japanese lasagna or baked mussels.  There isn't alot on the menu like hamachi kamas or soft shell crab appetizers (like our fave sushi place) but like I said we only come here to satisfy our sushi craving when we don't feel like driving too far.  Our fave thing on the menu is the seared salmon belly, if they have it cause sometimes they run out and thats a bummer.  Otherwise, their AYCE menu is OK they have a pretty good lunch/dinner special if you just want to take something good home to eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared salmon bell, delicious! (not always on the menu though :( )

jAEAuhCcaI94cS3Pbv133g.text: Update: I try and limit my 5 Star reviews to the places that have truly earned it. And while Yelp only shows 7 check-ins I've been here over 40 times. I've filled up 3 AYCE punch cards and pretty much every weekend, and sometimes during the week my wife and I end up here.   Sure it's on Boulder Highway. And yes it's a little small. And if they are busy sometimes you might have to wait a few minutes to get your orders in. They get a lot of Uber Eats orders especially on weekends that can slow things down a little. But when you get a G-Spot roll or a 911 spicy roll on your plate and you take a bite...yeah, even those of us who are grumpy about waiting forget all about it. (The fish from salmon to halibut tastes fresh. And their spicy rolls are not excessively loaded with sauces and spices either. They don't just slap it together and send it out, they try and make sure it's made correctly).  Again, 40+ visits. We've only had one roll in all that time that wasn't made right and when we called it to their attention it was addressed quickly and without any attitude. Even my 7 year old son doesn't mind going with us now as he's a fan of their fried shrimp and their ice cream!   5 Stars. And those stars have been earned by great food at a reasonable price and backed by great service.

Dkf1JXR8IzGk8Lad8ijE-A.text: Sushi was good but I feel there are better places in town. This place is too far out of the way if you don't live on the east side. Had a very hard time understanding the waitress.

SLLK5V1tjFl3uz8lHiceJw.text: Have been here a few times but never disrespected like I was tonight. Oh yeah, and the food was bad, too.  Sitting at the sushi bar, a friend and I ordered some halibut and some other nigiri. We had all-you-can-eat, and the halibut was really good, so we ordered some more.  And it wasn't good. We each ate a couple pieces and it just tasted a little too "fishy" and not in a good way. We told the chef at the sushi bar.  "No, it's same fish, you order too much"  Uhhhhh ok. My friend and I both had tasted this fish and it was definitely not the same as the previous order. We asked if he could taste it, but he was really rude.  "No, you eat. It's same fish. You order too much"  Yeah, ok, man. So we ate a couple more pieces. We felt like we were required to keep eating this disgusting fish, at the orders of this guy. Not exactly a nice dining experience.  I was kinda surprised at all of this, to be honest. People here are usually pretty nice. This chef was maybe 40-45, older than a lot of the other sushi chefs at the bar. He must be the owner, or has some kind of untouchable status. All I know is, he wouldn't have spoke to me like that outside of this business. We were at his mercy because he was the one making our food. A few other sushi chefs watched this all go down, too, so those must have been his employees. If this business were owned by one of them, they would have spoken up and given us real service. So, yeah, definitely employees.  Just go somewhere else. There's places like Sin City Sushi, Oyshi, and others that have really great service and food every time. This Sushi Twister place is in a crappy area on Boulder Hwy, the food is mediocre, and I seriously thought this chef was going to try to fight me tonight. I will never go back here. Avoid at all costs.

hPiemIjVZWowXiuL3U5o3A.text: My first time here was yesterday. The sushi rolls over all were good but then I woke up in the morning to throwing it all up. Not coming here again.

cFRSauWsYtpzMOcJGLxUeg.text: Favorite lunch and dinner sushi restaurant.  Prices are great but the food is even more amazing/ delicious.  This is my dad's favorite spot to come eat every time. We come out full/ happy and it doesn't kill my wallet

iq3pAM3EQg0pnDFnK9md0g.text: I come here every once and awhile because it's down the street from my girlfriend's house. The sushi is really fresh and tastes great. I usually order take-out from here, but the restaurant is really welcoming. The decor is simple Japanese, which works really well. In addition to having great food and a nice restaurant, Sushi Twister also has an awesome staff. Always super friendly and helpful!

Tan0MQN3zdV6EeQnPT9UXQ.text: Customer service was great!  The sushi unfortunately was not.   It was bad. The rice was bad. The fish was bad. The sauces were bad. Even the tea somehow was bad.   I don't want to be mean and put a place down, but I want people to know and not make the mistake I did. I'm a Las Vegas local, and if you're looking for ayce sushi or sushi just in general, choose a different place.  In conclusion, everything tasted bad. -A2-x_DOPcgP1UI4_XOwGA.text: Food is great but the Service lacking We come here all the time, the chef are always smiling. But the service is not that good. But again food is really really good

prOfegXzqdey0F8bS4wT-Q.text: So I had this all you can eat certificate and I decided to give this place a try today. Hot tea, miso, appetizers and desert were included in the all you can eat option. When I entered, I was greeted with a warm welcome. It was my first time sitting at a sushi bar--and I'll tell you it's pleasant to be here. My server was super nice. I'm the type to be casual with my own kind, so not only he was nice, but he was fun to talk to. The service is an A+!!! As for the food, I ate until I felt dizzy from being full. Yeah, the sushi was super fresh and that amazing. I ate 80% of the nigiri section of the menu. As for the appetizers, I ate tempura. Their tempura was the best, crispy and well made. After all that, I chose strawberry mochi as an option for my desert. Overall, I had a great time.   Gonna come back soon!

xDJJ051WZT2hF862aV-SrA.text: Finally went into this place. Food is really good. The atmosphere is great and definitely family friendly. I had spicy tuna roll. Very good! Will return soon and hopefully bring others as well.

gIsEZDk0T4Nrw4mPdfw2XA.text: This is the only restaurant that I have ever gotten up and left from before eating.   Before me and my fiance even started eating, the waitress was very rude by sternly insisting that if I was ordering "all you can eat" and my fiance wasn't, that there was "NO SHARING." Now, granted, given the area of the restaurant,  I'm sure they have had people take advantage,  however, this didn't start us off well at all. I suggest you police this type of thing when you actually see people taking True advantage of it.   We ordered drinks, then I started off with some salmon nigiri. It came out with brown edges on every single piece.  That was all she wrote for us. I called the waitress over, told her our issues, and said we will pay for our drinks but we are leaving. They had one last chance to redeem themselves a bit, and cover our drinks. I was being nice to even offer. They should have apologized and covered the drinks for us, but no, we paid for them.   Won't be back. I know good sushi. This wasn't it.

xn1OSWSvYjBHBRgt3oXAEg.text: We tried this place because we heard it was good. So here we are, trekking all the way from Sunmerlin (20 miles away.)  To be honest, the service was so so and the food was okay. The salmon sashimi was warmer than usual and the place smelled of wet rag. The rolls were loosely made and soaked in sauce. I'm giving this place 2 stars because I believe it has a chance of succeeding.

G8NQBJ2huJL901jqbrgWjw.text: My wife and I came here for a quick dinner. We had the following:  Salmon Teriyaki Combo $10.95 "AAA" Sushi Quality Atlantic King salmon with Teriyaki, California Roll (8pc) Shrimp(2) & Vegetable Tempura(3). Including Rice, House Salad & Miso Soup  Royal California $3.57 (half) Deep-fried California roll with eel sauce.  Cowgirl $5.98 (half) Avocado & Cucumber inside, wrapped with slice of Beef Tenderloin. Topped with House Special Sauce and Green Onion  Boulder Crunchy $5.75 (half) Shrimp Tempura & Cucumber Captured with sliced avocado & splashed w/ tempura crumbs  Tiger $ 6.50 (half) Shrimp Tempura, cucumber wrapped with spicy tuna & avocado  This resto is located in a small plaza on Tropicana. The resto is fairly small with a sushi bar and tv. Their sushi was pretty good. I particularly liked the Boulder Crunchy and the Cowgirl. My wife had the Salmon Teriyaki Combo which was a lot of food and can easily be shared with 2 people. I wouldn't order the Royal California again bc having a California roll deep fried did not really make it taste better. Overall, this is a good sushi place as they have cheap prices and I like that they have half portion options.

uNFrO4o8_RtG5gFgpPSv4A.text: i'm not that big of a sushi snob to know what is the best sushi place but all of the rolls i had here were very good. The service was outstanding. Our server was at the table evey couple of minutes either taking our order, filling our drinks or bringing more rolls. The AYCE was well worth the price. They had a Monday Night Football special that I overlooked but seemed like a great deal. I would definately return here. Very Friendly Staff, always helps your dinning experience!!

hrwiKdmoFYoJTA5YgPK0Pg.text: Another AYCE sushi place. I went here a year ago and remember it being better. The service was still good, they're fast and constantly checked on us. Here's a breakdown of the sushi we ate:  Volcano - too much mayo tasting.    Dragon - rice a little slushy. Eel sauce is good. Average everything else    Boulder crunch - could only really taste the avocado and the eel sauce. Would not recommend   Are you ready - it really is spicy. And I can handle a good amount. That said, it's an ok roll. Can't really taste the roll through all the spicyness.   Lasagna - too mushy. Couldn't really taste the flavors  Hamachi (yellowtail) - tasty. Texture was alright.  Albacore (bincho) - a little salty. Texture was off. Would not order  Halibut (hirame) - texture was terrible. Not a fan

7gfDxWrKQ257lWhCRjbOBw.text: I think that all the (all you can eat sushi places) on yelp with 4+ stars tend to be good.  This was no exception.   We went to this place on saturday after trying to go to Yama Sushi to try something new and not wait 1.5 hours.    After the initial 15 min , we were seated and had drinks in our hands.  Our waiter was helpful and patient.  She came frequently to check on orders, after the intial difference in names.... I found all the tasty dishes I liked.    If you have a chance to go, definately do it and try the firecracker, baked scallops and muscles!!

7cXdULwsjz-igRTg9jaBMA.text: 3.5 stars would be more accurate I think, but I decided to round up.   AYCE sushi that doesn't take me 20 minutes to drive to from my house. YAY! Location, for me, is a plus...   Sadly, I have only been to Sushi Twister twice. The lack of visits is certainly not related to the location, price or quality of the sushi though... The husband doesn't eat much seafood so sushi for dinner just isn't an option as often as I would like it to be!  I have never had a problem with service here, and while there is a time limit for AYCE, it has never been an issue for me. The sushi is good, not mind blowingly amazing, just good.

QsS5Cdu-YJvJErOTU1pxgg.text: We love Sushi Twister for all  you can eat. Their party platter is good too. Best Sushi spot on the East side.

RBeFj0pqMabxCKYVv6brdw.text: New to the area, we sought out a sushi place on Yelp and we were very satisfied!  This place is small, like... 10 tables and a very long bar area.  Groovy music entertained us that we both enjoyed; they have a large projection TV going on one of the walls.  The tables are 2 top and 4 top, every other one.  Be prepared for shoulder to shoulder seating and the possibility of introductions!  They tried to place us at a 2 top table, but we insisted on the extra room for the 4.  Paul said it was the best sushi he's ever had!  Me not being a sushi fan, I found other delights and was very satisfied!  I loved the cooked salmon dinner and shrimp tempura!  In fact, I ordered two servings of the shrimp tempura!  Amazing...  Enjoy this great find!  We did!  I'm giving it 4 stars due to the lack of room.  Expand - give us some privacy while we eat your delicious food!

_IAX_m6xnjrL0AqB09-Qbw.text: I'm loving the all you can eat sushi! Dead dragon is so good. And Philadelphia roll is also delicious.

m8Uv8HpaxmBfMr1IHfGW2w.text: I sat at the bar and ordered Asahi (regular) which cost five dollars but it is a delicious beer and well worth it.  To start I had two pieces of sear tuna which melted in my mouth the sweetest umami flavor imaginable. That cost 4.25 I ordered a half roll of spicy crab which could have been a little spiceier but overall was delicious. I finished that Asahi pretty quickly and ordered a sake bomb that coat 3.85. I guzzled it down and ordered a deep fried royal California. the whole meal was $21.02. I highly recommend this establishment.

lgUN4ql7y4XqcgEe6KA8jg.text: AYCE is well worth it. Fish has always been fresh. We dabble around the menu, but always make sure to get the spider and dragon rolls and finish the meal with the are you ready.

acbtHedkU3w0LuLBJpjILw.text: AYCE amazing. It's a small spot. Lots to choose from and all are yummy. Ordering half rolls is okay..some items you can't, but no worries they are so good you would have wanted more anyways. And if your dining partner is eating AYCE too..you can share. Time limit is 45 minutes for lunch I believe and 1 hour for dinner. What are you waiting for ...go now!!!

dpEBf9c-UED1o1Yf3l5L-w.text: i had ONE piece of sushi left at the end of my meal. seriously, ONE! the lady server told me if i don't finish it i'd have to pay fir that whole sushi roll. so instead of arguing with her i just shoved that last piece in my mouth. so silly. what a way to lose a customer...over 1 piece of sushi lol

np-r877ObvWg6h483SmZBg.text: One of the best sushi places I've ever been too. There all you can it is pretty reasonable at only $25 dollars for dinner service. I highly recommend there Tiger Yamisaki roll. Its my favorite.

STAuNwG83PeKOvcRrNpjJA.text: I don't know why it took me so long to write a review for this place. This is our favorite sushi place to go to. Near our house and the best sushi around.  The service is great and the food is amazing. Good fish to rice ratio. They also have shiso which alot of sushi places don't have. You can order half rolls for all, except for the rolls that have soft shell crab. The menu is alphabetized and they also have the rolls by category (i.e. spicy, deep fried, baked, etc.). Dessert is included in the AYCE, limit of one for mochi ice cream. For the non sushi eaters, they have a full menu as well. If you are with a large group, this may not be the place for you as it is a tiny restaurant. Great date night place for couples and if you sit at the bar the chefs are all very entertaining. All in all a great place to come.

CwbLsUvFRb3ZZTaaxDIONg.text: WOW this is the only place I can get the Salmon Loves Lemon Sushi Roll. It's my favorite!

BK2USc2gKiVS_AxsJtMaQw.text: Great Sushi ... I had all u can eat ... However, I do have a compliant: ... I asks for a bowl of rice and miso soup for my 2 yrs old. They charge me $3 for it and $2.50 for a piece of Mochi ice cream, because they saw her eat it instead of me.  We spend over a hunded on the bill and they nickel and dime you. This is poor service on Management. ... The waiter service was good. Kids under 3 always eat for free.  How much can a 2 yrs old eat??  I have a lot of friends who visit Vegas all the time. This is not a place I would recommend family w/kids to dine.  This is not a family friendly place.   I took off 2 star for that.

rITlVya-Q6J_5lW6gxcZNw.text: I love sushi.  Let me say it again...I LOVE SUSHI.  I love it in the morning, I love it in the afternoon, heck, I love it in the evening.    I stumbled upon Sushi Twister while meeting a friends' friend there for lunch.  From the location (trop and boulder) I thought that it would be ahem, ghetto.  Upon walking in you are immediately greeted and the staff is all smiles.  You get seated right on the spot, whether its the sushi bar or a table (we always opt for the table).    The menu has some of the most intriguing and delicious rolls I've ever seen, as well as the favorites of any sushi restaurant.  Things like...  Rum Jungle roll?  Sure!  The Mexican roll?  Sure!   Also they are NEVER stuffed with too much rice...you get the amount of fish you pay for!  For price-wise, they have all you can eat for $27, which I think is a little pricey, but the rolls definitely make up for it.  So why do I only give it 4 stars?  Whenever you get all you can eat, there's usually a rule saying you have to eat everything you order.  The staff seem to be everywhere, looking at every roll that enters your mouth to make sure you do not share it with someone else (like me, who never orders all you can eat sushi since I can only handle 1.5 rolls).    But hey, friendly staff, great sushi, drinks always filled, and not as expensive as other sushi restaurants.  Try it :)

l3FV--W4YATcF_wklW1tSQ.text: The service is great. The food is wonderful. I have been here many times and keep returning because it's all around a good experience.

yGs4o8hSpgzZHVBFksvJbg.text: Best all you can eat sushi in town? But "Best" is such a big word so let's settle for "Great".  The place has become a fail-safe dinner option ever since I moved into town. Service is great & very prompt, no matter what you pick off the all you can eat menu, its always pleasurable.  That being said my current tally of what I've  had (will continually update): -Kill Samurai -Crispy Vacation -Spider Roll -Rum Jungle -Dynamite  While I'm not a big fan of my scallops (Dynamite) swimming in a bowl of grease & mayo, after you shake off all the grease its light on the palate & heavy on taste.   Japanese salsa is such a wonderful food invention! Light, rich, mildly hot & extremely versatile that would I would prefer all my sushi be served with it! Or just pack it up in a jar for me to consume at home!  It seems that their menu has changed since my last visit before I started yelping.

vHkwQGpQ4tY533dZSqZNrg.text: Seriously the best sushi place in town !! Prices are very reasonable and great service !

Ru1BBUKZUaKQSopvWK0gfg.text: hands down my favorite place for sushi in Vegas ... and let me tell you I have tried a few! My bf and I eat there usually 1-2 times a week.  Dang is my personal favorite sushi chef, he makes the best rolls and is always willing to explain what something is. The staff is always friendly and willing to make suggestions. All You Can Eat is well worth its weight in sushi, and they have a punch card so you can earn a free one. Most rolls you can order in half size so you can try new things without having to commit. I have yet to try something there I dont like. if you go you HAVE to try the monkey balls .... they are amazing! Oh and PS they make their own eel sauce which is killer on cali rolls   LOVE LOVE LOVE SUSHI TWISTER!!!

XK4CvlkAXil1EPQmZZcpMQ.text: I love love love this place. the sushi is amazing. my favorite is the San fransico roll and also the magic mountain. very clean place. the fish is always fresh. the only thing I have with this place is that the soda can b really watery since they use pitchers to fill up the cups. other than that no complaints. servers are nice usually. not always too attentive to me when I go but they get super packed so I get it. as long as my sushi is good I'm good ;) probably the best sushi place in Vegas.

wV1Fbpk7T2pTN9AlcYSgkQ.text: Wow, this place was goooooood. Very clean, big big plus. Friendly waitress, love it! The food was so good. The only negative, I couldnt find it in the plaza, lol.  So, I ordered the lunch special veggie tempura. It came with miso, salad, and 4 california rolls. The miso was good. Not too salty and it was flavorful. The salad was yum. It wasn't a typical ginger dressing, but it wasnt that sweet poppy stuff some places use. I would have liked a bit more but it was a lunch portion, so I can't complain. The rolls were good. I wish the crab wasn't the "mush" it was, but the rice was REAL good. The wasabi seemed "muted". I like it nice and spicy and when I put a big glob on my roll, my nose immediately opens up. It wasn't the case here but it was good. The tempura was delicious. Not greasy at all and I love love the pumpkin squash. LOVE IT! The carrot was perfect and so was the broccoli. I will definitely come back here when I am in the neighborhood. Very good! Oh, and the prices for 2 lunches was less than $15 for all that. I'd say that's pretty darn good! So, good food, good service and good prices, right up my alley!

bOCPXAa4ioWZ6--38oBUHA.text: Finally I get to return here to yelp about this place. this place is great. I've tried everything on the menu except 2 items. I like the all you can eat.  I have tried other places and nothing seems to compare, but I'll keep trying since I love Sushi.  do you like Saki? try the raspberry Saki its devine.

ozuRvihnEdUGvw830XEzxg.text: The food was fresh and the service from the food servers was outstanding.   When in Las Vegas make the drive out to the Boulder Highway and enjoy the best sushi in all of southern Nevada.

kttODliTslQwoHoZI7Kn2g.text: When I originally moved to Las Vegas, I HATED sushi. The texture of it, the taste, just wasn't my thing. A few times my friends brought me to Sushi Factory East (which is now closed, perfect timing since I just got a full stamp card...) a few times. One day I wanted sushi of my own for lunch and Twister was right down the road. I went in, ordered a Japanese Lasagna to go, and walked home.  I have NEVER been blown away by food like this. The roll was simply the most delicious thing I have ever consumed and is now my usual favorite here. (I always get at LEAST half of a roll!)  The quality here is unparalleled. The service is quick and amazing. The ONLY thing I don't like about this place is how everyone there hawks you down when someone at your table doesn't have AYCE. Not everyone is a thief, and looking at customers constantly so they don't share is completely unnecessary. Have some faith in people. Especially people who are in there bi-weekly spending $40 on sushi.  If you have a group of 6+ you might have to wait since the establishment is quite small inside and they don't do reservations. Keep that in mind!  Free Wi-Fi if you connect to "attwifi" from Starbucks next door during business hours!

jM67woQNyXf-caPuRPpL4g.text: Hands down, the worst sushi I've ever had. I thought I already experienced the worst, but this place showed me how nasty sushi rolls could really be.  For the first time in my life, I actually snuck food into my napkin and went to the restroom to throw it out.  Like some other AYCE sushi places, Sushi Twister has a bunch of rules. They will charge you extra even if you leave a few grains of rice on your plate.   FOOD The rolls were horrendous.   One roll I ordered was the volcano roll, which is supposed to be topped with scallops.  However, I only found one tiny sliver of a scallop mixed in with tons of sauce and other mystery meat.  I'm shocked this place has gotten many good reviews. Big disappointment.

1BJ9rKsXo8xcjsyWptrNNQ.text: I came here last night for the first time and had all-you-can-eat.  First, it was pretty packed -- the wait was about 20-30 minutes around 9:00 PM for a group of 6 -- but the wait was worth it.  I ordered the rainbow, volcano, and salmon loves lemon rolls and the screaming orgasm appetizer.  The screaming orgasm came out first, it was presented differently than I've seen at most sushi bars, but the "ecstasy" sauce was the best part of it.  There is a one-order limit on these, so I'd suggest if you're going with a big group and you want more than one to have everyone in the group order one, whether they want it or not to get the most out of it.   The rainbow and salmon loves lemon rolls came out together.  No complaints there.  The rainbow is a pretty generic roll, so it's hard to mess up, but the fish all tasted great and fresh.  The salmon loves lemon roll reminds me of a roll at Sushi Factory East (can't remember what it's called, maybe the LA Boxing roll?).  Anyway, I liked the thin slice of lemon on top, it added an interesting flavor to the salmon and california roll underneath.   The volcano roll came out last and it was pretty much perfect -- not too much yum yum sauce, but enough to get the flavor.  I also love the baked scallops on top.  I also tried pieces of the Mexican and Rum Jungle rolls.  The Mexican roll was tasty and just the right amount of spicy; the Rum Jungle roll, on the other hand, was good, except for the Japanese "salsa" on top.  I'd probably get it without the salsa next time.   For dessert, I had the mango mochi, which was nothing special, but good.  There is a one-order limit on the mochi and only two flavors (mango and strawberry), but the green tea and red bean ice cream is unlimited.  The AYCE dinner was $26.95 and there was an automatic gratuity of 18% for our group of 6.  They also have a punch card, where if you eat there 10 times you get 1 free.   The service was better than most sushi places I've been to, so that was a plus.  They were pretty attentive and usually came by pretty frequently so that we could order more rolls on a steady basis.  Overall, I liked this place, but I most likely will not return unless I'm in the area.

UbqzI6X4Hm8mjyUOrMpU4A.text: Best sushi joints around, great selection always fresh. Salmon loves lemon roll is a must try.

KjdG7liUVR5LNlBxM3mX3Q.text: I've been coming here since I was a junior in high school and this place is always as satisfying as the first time I walked in ! Great environment and welcoming staff. Sushi is fresh and very tasty.

D5sfJbH8153odYDn9PBaJg.text: I like sushi twister, I really do. But do you have to be such Nazis about the AYCE rules?  Your are already one of the more expensive AYCE in town, I've been here 1000 x's, yes I know No SHARING , Eat RICE, No leftovers & you are going to swoop around my table checking my progress if you think I have ordered too much.  The fish is good quality, I give you that...but when nearly every roll is fully fried or involves SOMETHING fried, it isn't really fresh anymore anyway right?  I like how the menu is set up with  *baked rolls *fried rolls (even tho, again almost everything has shrimp tempura or crumb) BUT when ordering AYCE thu almost always immediately take away your menu & give you the paper one which does not show even HALF of the appetizers & Even some rolls available w AYCE! If you are on this side of town, go for it....but there are friendly, TASTIER AYCE places closer to town!

Ar6Ef657VMrs4ABkqrYwzA.text: Would not accommodate in switching tables. My mom told the employee that she wanted a larger table and the worker told her no because it was their busy time and if a larger party comes, we would have to move. There were 2 empty tables and it was past 2PM. Are you kidding me? Go find another restaurant that would ease your dining experience. There's so many different sushi restaurants around the area that you can go to.

183qUPNxdsZLAudT2Jxd-w.text: I tend to write novel-reviews that could probably be turned into plays. But I can't say enough good things about this place.   This place deserves more than just a 5-pack of stars. They really deserve buckets and troughs of the things. Big, shiny, red, buckets of obese stars. Get you, your mouth, and your tummy over here immediately. You really cannot wait any longer. If you find yourself in Vegas doing the strip-thing, you need to make the ~10 minute drive to Sushi Twister.    Three initial must-dos: AYCE, sit at the bar, and come hungry.   One initial tip: Order carefully, they will charge you for any leftovers you cannot finish. (Great policy in my opinion).   The man-piece and I came here for lunch before our long road-trip back home to San Francisco. It was probably the best decision of our lives. For around $22, we sat at the bar and enjoyed gorgeously delicious waves of fresh, expertly prepared sushi, and other wonderfully unique dishes.   We mainly stuck to the nigiri menu. I'm not saying this is what you should do, but these little guys aren't your typical nigiri (and I live in San Francisco, a veritable sushi-snob space station). They really surpassed anything I have experienced. Expect fresh fish (weird, being in the middle of the desert), and really amazing flavors. They are garnished with the perfect amount of wasabi, sometimes green onions, and various soy-ish sauces that give your wee nigiri bites extra-excellent flavor. We probably tried 80% of the nigiri menu, but some must-haves include:   - Garlic tuna (FAVORITE) - Seared ahi (OTHER FAVORITE)  - Halibut (OTHER FAVORITE) - Sake (FAVORITE) - Saba (OTHER FAVORITE) - Red snapper (OTHER FAVORITE)  Before I continue to gush about the food, I must say that the service was spectacular. As soon as we walked in, we were taken aback by the 7-9 people enthusiastically declaring "IRASSHAIMASE!!!" I twitched a little at the loud enthusiasm, but we knew we were in for a treat. The servers always check up on you, the chefs are wonderfully receptive, seem to love their work, and also seem to have fortress-like memories considering the slew of orders being verbally submitted by the servers. Be comforted.   Back to the food!   The roll menu is impressive and involves unique combinations that I'm not used to. They have a great array of cooked rolls, of which we liked the Dead Dragon, Fire Cracker, . Use caution here -- I can see it being easy to fill up on these delicious rolls and be too full to enjoy other areas of the glorious menu.   I'm not usually one for appetizers mainly because they fill me up before I get to the good stuff, but these appetizers are cautiously portioned so you can enjoy a variety of dishes and flavors but still have room in your precious tummy-space for more. Favorites:   - Monkey Balls: spicy tuna and mushroom encased in a satisfying tempura shell. Nothing like their Chimp Nad cousins. (I suck.) - Hot Shrimp: shrimp, spicy tuna, and cream cheese magicked with tempura to make a seriously delicious snack. You must try.  Needless to say, the man-piece and I were speechless after our meal here. It's both a gut-wrenching tragedy and a wallet-saving blessing that it's so far away from where we live. That said, I can't really complain much hailing from the sushi-space-station that is San Francisco. Sushi Twister should think about storming its way up to the Bay. You'd be welcomed with open arms and mouths. Thank you for a truly excellent and memorable meal!

TRMAI17HER1-2l_wuqxsaQ.text: Found this place near my house. Great ambiance. Clean, comfortable restaurant. Very good to relax eat and have a conversation. Food was good. Good size portions. A lot of variety on the AYCE menu. Will definitely come again.

4z0aFKuEqSpdUnG6k3Cg5w.text: My favorite ayce sushi spot right now.   They have the most appetizers to choose from and they have a wide variety of rolls to choose from.    The best thing is that you can actually order half-rolls here, unlike many other places.  This means you can try way more things!!    I liked the philly w/ a twist and angry ninja.  The salmon loves lemon was my absolute favorite though.   Those flavors were meant to be together.    Japanese lasagna is good here too but it doesnt (nothing does) beat the japanese lasagna from Kaizen next to hard rock hotel.    The uni was fresh!    When the uni is good, the restaurant follow suit!    I've been here a few times, and this place never disappoints.  Worth the wait if you happen to go on a busy night.

tEQSfxDP7YFdoiID_9fZGw.text: One of the top sushi places in town. I mostly like to eat their salmon and seared tuna nigiri. Love their red bean ice cream, too.  For big parties (since everytime I'm here, it's with a big party of 6+), they will do split checks. Ask for the stamp card so that you get a stamp for each person and get the 10th ayce free.  Unlike some places, they will do half rolls, but not on everything. They only have two types of mochi ice cream (and it's one per person) of mango and strawberry. For their unlimited ice cream, they only have green tea and red bean. I wish they had chocolate of either :(.  Each time, I'm pretty happy with their service so that's a plus. Pretty consistent, too. The only reason why I wouldn't come here as often would be because of its location. So far away from me :(. If you're in the area, DROP BY FOR SOME SUSHI!

6dpPKzl7OcV_vg22KAIh9g.text: This review is mainly about their customer service. Dined here with some friends on a Friday night. Unfortunately for us they close at 11, so coming late in the evening we were left with an hour or so to eat. When we were seated our waitress seemed a little annoyed, which was just really upsetting. She stressed that the kitchen would be closing in 45 minutes and that she would just rather have us acye-ers place all of our orders at once. We did just that. She made frequent visits to the table and occasionally threw in comments such as, "Anything else? We all want to go home, you know."  No one at my table seemed to take offense, but I, however, found it very disrespectful. The restaurant was not yet closing so for her to just hate her life and take it out on poor, innocent customers was just rude.    It's unfortunate because the food was pretty good. I just can't get over the fact that our server had such a foul attitude the whole evening. It's like: Relax and smile a little. Everything's going to be OK. They have set such low standards for customer service that I can't bring myself to rate them more than three stars. Regardless of how good their food was. Meh. Sorry, not sorry.

xGsJwK-4J-50A6bRsnJSrA.text: They have the best all you can eat sushi in Vegas! I love this place! When I think about sushi the 1st think that comes in my mind is Sushi Twister. My favorite is lasagne, Mexican n fire cracker. I wish they have domestic beer tho. Great job guys!!!

iBSjdhJ3n_jEQXsCUXgvTw.text: You would think their To Go portions would be small but in fact, they were perfect. Very delicious. It's in a sketchy neighborhood but its so good!!

ZoafIpvXebjtq_G4wnVFOg.text: Ok, over the course of the last few months my love affair with Sushi Twister has intensified. Like any relationship, we have had our ups and down, but managed to beat the odds and continue our romance. The food is consistently delicious and the fish is fresh. Their rice to fish ratio still bothers me a bit, but I'll let it slide. There are times when the services is spotty (an older female server will leave you hanging for quite some time), but there are times when the service is pretty flawless. This weekend we had a young gentleman as our server as he was on top of his game.   Their selection of nigiri is great and choices of baked and regular rolls vast. My favorites are Friday the 13th, Cowgirl, Oh My God, Ecstasy, and Rum Jungle. I also really enjoyed their baked mussels. I am two stamps away from a free AYCE meal...oooooh yeah!

fiVjKNHZGVmKZZ8-iOn4Sg.text: Cozy little spot. Nice location. Never too crowded. Service is always nice and friendly. AYCE sushi is at a great price. My families favorite spot. Great date restaurant.

EyrC4hQw7KVePlwN8_45fw.text: This place is definitely my go to if I want to stay in my area. The staff is friendly and attentive. My cravings are definitely satisfied when I leave sushi twister. I think they have one of the best services for AYCE.  The only downside is the nigiri. I'm not sure what rice they use or the way they make it, but it always falls apart :( My plate is always a mess from all the rice falling apart so I only get to eat the fish. I would Still recommend it if you're short on time and you want great sushi.

q_smeWwHgWbspGgHH__-kQ.text: My second favourite sushi place in town! I've been coming to this sushi place since the 1st day it opened! Years ago!  Loved it then, love it now.  Great pricing, great food, and great service.  My only complaint is sometimes there's a long wait and the front area is really smaller and crammed.

jv_Cqwr7B0n6XBAQTu3LFw.text: Had a craving for sushi and this place is just up the road so it's convenient.  As always they greet you as you walk in, I didn't sit at the bar I opted  for a table which a couple were still available.  I was hungry  so I went for the all you could inhale, I consider myself somewhat of adventurous when it comes to sushi so I tend to play it safe and order regular cut rolls. The Boulder Crunchy, Caterpillar, Tiger, Philadelphia. They don't use much sauces so I used a lot of soy sauce and wasabi.  I had a the Green Tea ice cream and a Strawberry Mochi to finish it off, I walked off full and very satisfied.

WYvH4iBpkZsocnbqxOISrQ.text: Today I unfortunately lost the money I needed to pay for my girlfriends and I food. We had no money as I felt quite embarrassed we had to call my girlfriends mother to come pay for the food. We also had to keep them waiting after the closing Time. And after all this the greeters still had a genuine smile and a positive attitude. They honestly seem like good people. We need more people like them in this world

I-oKnvDSVyKBvV2VTd8Z7w.text: Love this place. The service is always awesome and so is the food! Decently priced too!

G1lE0gWdTQy_C59xBNqLAw.text: I have never tasted wasabi in my shrimp nigiri and this guy put WAY TOO MUCH. Ruined my meal

4T3G3RWSiqkR3HWbg98oiw.text: The AYCE sushi is great tasting and the service was great. When my friend suggested this spot I was leery because of the location, but the sushi was worth it.  Definitely a busy spot, there was a wait for a table during our meal. Our waitress was great. She stopped by often to refill our drinks and to continue putting in our food order.   The price for AYCE sushi was reasonable, around $26 per person for dinner. The AYCE menu offered a large variety of items. They offer standard rolls, specialty rolls, appetizers, nigiri, and even a couple of desserts.   My favorite roll was the Salmon Loves Lemon. We ordered this twice because it was so fresh and refreshing with the lemon. The 9-1-1 roll was good and a little spicy, but nothing over the top. Boulder Crunchy was good, but not my favorite. Gyoza was yummy and not overly greasy given that you get to choose between deep fried and pan-fried. The House Salad had leafy greens and the ginger dressing was refreshing. The sushi was delicious enough to justify a return visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza &amp; Salmon Loves Lemon Roll
Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boulder Crunchy

R6hsI8noPzrObC4zkjEAjw.text: DO NOT GO HERE!  If I could give zero stars, I would.  The staff was VERY rude. While eating my meal one of the server ladies kept coming up to us and telling us not to waste food and to eat everything on our plate. Wth?!! She our mother?  To make it worse, after we left the place, when I checked my credit card statement, THEY ADDED ADDITIONAL TIP ONTO MY SIGNED RECEIPT! If I'm not mistaking.... isn't this against the law??!!

H31UqBt8BkwKfKpHj7fKdg.text: Hmmm. This place used to be my favorite in town, but not anymore.. read why below  The good: They do half rolls, so you can try more variety before getting fat stomach full! They have a frequent flyer punch card for those that pig out at least once a month here. One of my favorite teriyaki chicken skewers in town on their appetizer list. Great variety of fish and food with the ayce. They yell something in Japanese that sounds like, "Fvck you" when you are leaving, so it's fun to yell it back. Haha  The bad: I've been here about 30 times, and although service is fast, it's not always as friendly as it used to be. This place has gotten BUSY over the years, and some of the waiters seem stressed out and rushed. Punch card expires in a year. I had 9 punches and then it expired. It's nessled in a strip Mall that's had AT LEAST 3 different shootings in the past 2 years. The food quality is good, but it used to be great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big B roll with beef on top and shrimp inside. Very tasty..

0RphVh_azOqky9FVAn4peg.text: Really like this place and the servers. LOVE the spicey rolls. (Call the Dr is our favorite) nice decorating, never crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sc9kisaNSIA2x7dcSe1chw.text: Just ehh. I got that lobster roll and the teriyaki roll. Not impressed. Falls apart as soon as it's grabbed. Rice is stale and dry. The lobster roll also isn't lobster at all, it's imitation crab cubes from a grocery store. At least that's what it looks AND TASTES like. Give em props for being cheap and innovated but step your game up. Please. There's tons of sushi places in town and this one I can pass on. Two stars because I'm not mean enough to give a one star when there could easily be improvement. Lol

1Dr7VD_1UR_g31G5UoLTNw.text: Not a bad place. Lil place in a shopping center. They have a lil frequent eater card. Not a bad deal.  The service was ok.  Rolls were ok, atmosphere is ok.

U7WjuIaFBqUJj2rOCqyX6Q.text: One of my go-to Sushi places and it's still very good to come here. They upgraded their menu and have added more dishes to their lunch specials and they All look divine! I ordered the Salmon Skin salad and it's very delicious! It's one of my favorite dishes to eat when I come here and, as always, it's very delicious.  The service is great coupled with good smiles and attentive hosts.  This place, I recommend to everyone!

Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Twister Lunch Special. Reasonable price and portion is big. Yummy too!

FUT4-aPu9ksbr3I53k3rkg.text: Our alll time FAVORITE place to eat sushi! No matter how many times we go we never leave dissatisfied! We also have tried many other sushi places but WE always come back! Our favorite rolls are: Matsuri, Angry Ninja ( if u can handle spicy), or a regular Ninja, Fire Cracker, Kill Sumarai and GARLIC tuna is OUR alll time favorite also! That sauce is the best ever!   The only thing I hate about this place is just the drive because we live on the SW but thats not going to keep us from going!   Another note to add: this place is sister company with our favorite Ramen place- Ramen Sora! Another favorite of ours!!!!!

POuKU4nBnpFtz_6XHNPLYw.text: They have returned to the traditional seating method ever since. While the kiosk is still present, it's not being used. So happy!!

os1anph0ZGVD8qW_nHl_Gg.text: Sushi and non sushi lovers, this is the place. I've been coming here for years, because the flavors are off the charts. The salmon teriyaki combo with tempura is my calling. Let's discuss this plate of heaven. The salmon is crispy on the outside and perfect on the inside. The salad's dressing is addicting. Ok. Here goes. The TEMPURA. Perfectly crispy & not oily shrimp & veggies. I'm not a shrimp lover, but I'll eat theirs. Every bite. As for the rolls... Everything is tasty, but the Japanese lasagna is out of this world. Crab, avocado, cream cheese and baked to perfection. Oh yum yum sauce. Everything is yum yum about this place. And watch the ninja artwork of Koki & the sushi chefs. At least I burned calories watching them haha. btw they have an all you can eat menu that's easy, not a silly receipt with a pencil to fill out. GO TO SUSHI TWISTER & THANK ME LATER.

HupcyrRVPzfFZDZapQ6CEw.text: My first time here im so disappointed! I ordered dinner salmon teriyaki plate substitute California rolls to crunchy rolls. She did not mentioned it was $6 more to substitute .If she explain well  i rather get all you can eat just a few more dollars!  I will not come back here anymore!!

MqSxdpvgm51JdEa9xKPg5A.text: I usually come to Sushi twister for AYCE sushi or their seafood salad which is a great option if you're looking for a substantially nutritious light meal. They have a great assortment of rolls and appetizers, and I am a big fan of their miso soup. Always a hit or miss to guess if they'll be busy but definitely worth the wait.

cQcPOh2j682Gu-w2GFm6xg.text: The worst service ever my 3 year old never even eat he was sleep at table and they still charged me 21.02 gratuity for a 5th person. Parmahe manger that was the name given and vanni served my table and all was bad from begging.never again will I come here.

wQm-ZsB81An1lS4tr0FbZA.text: This is one of my least favorite AYCE. First time and will also be my last. They do not have fresh wasabi, quail egg or the hotate. The green tea is served in a can. The super white is on the today's special and the sauce they put on top of the nigiri is yucky.   They have two choices for dessert...whether ice cream or mocha ice cream.   Wasted my dinner here. Should have gone to sushimon.

gtELtkA4iGruYDitkvcSWg.text: Hmm I did come in for the AYCE but left paying for a la carte.   My co worker and I discovered this place after going to a pumpkin patch nearby.  Now, I feel like this joint can be compared to Jjanga on Decatur because every roll I got was a 10/10.   Upon arrival, there was no wait, and we got seated immediately. The server was so pleasant and patient that it made me feel bad when we made things so complicated for him.  Let me just say that I always go out to eat sushi with my sister and we eat so much. We can eat up to 8 full rolls but that wasn't the case for this place. I went ahead and ordered 6 rolls as my co worker ordered 2 rolls. I was so surprised that she barely finished one roll. Yeah well we ended up having to pay for the left overs and it was either $88 in ayce or $80 in a la carte + we can take the left overs to go. We still got mochi in the end--they only have mango and strawberry-- I've come to a conclusion that most of their sushi rolls come in 10 pieces rather than the 6-8 I'm used to at other sushi joints. Could be why we still ended up with so much at the end but I'm frustrated that I didn't finish everything. I will be back! ** Oh yeah, ayce is $27 per person**

Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left plate: deep fried Cali roll and Spicy Kist Right: Japanese lasagna on top and Alaskan Summer on the bottom

7eDud1BcCRxcZgFTcfJlFg.text: We love this gem of a sushi restaurant! It's in a not so good area, yet people are lined up at the door to eat hear. Friendly service, great food! Plenty of options to choose from. Sit at the counter for a fun experience!

_xcMI-81pyVUDI2ngwNLsg.text: This is going to be a long review because I think this place is going to be a favorite of mine. If I could give them 6 stars I totally would.   We were a party of 3 and did the AYCE at dinner time. The price was 26-27.00 per person.  The hostess and waitress/waiters cheerfully greeted us and we were immediately seated. This was our first time here but everything was self explanatory but if you need instruction for AYCE they offered to explain it or they have signage to look back on, well up on ( signs are posted on the walls).   The decor is simple we kind of wished it was a little less fast foodie ish but the location is small. A fish tank or something might really look nice in there.   Now onto the best part...THE SUSHI The sushi was delicious and we ate our fair share of rolls and nigiri. The fish was fresh and served beautifully. Each roll had its own flavor and displayed like a work of art. Our water glasses were kept full, the waitresses were attentive and kept bringing our rolls out to us at a nice pace.   We ordered:  *Octopus Nigiri - my favorite it was delicious *Tuna Nigiri *Spicy Tuna hand roll- was delicious *Rum jungle *San Francisco fire  *Chris Roll *Yellowtail Mango wiz shrimp- my favorite  *Screaming for vengeance  *Spicy Kist *9-1-1 *We also ordered a roll that had yellowtail and ponzu sauce that was not on the menu. It was delicious *Spider- the only one we wouldn't order again only because the other rolls were so good.  *Green tea ice cream and strawberry Mochi   Really want to try the plum cucumber roll next time. We left 100% satisfied and are still talking about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tCPaHxupfthyWsLQN3OzvA.text: Really really like the place! You can  order in or call to pickup or take out. Clean place and friendly staff. Reasonable prices and great food.

UixNY0yg2axdbtElsAKZIA.text: This place was recommended by my husband's cousin and by far, it has been our favorite dinner date spot. We've been going here for two years now. Dragon roll and Masago is my favorite dish while the hubby gets his tuna and salmon nigiri. For dessert, we love their green tea ice cream. We tried something different last week which was the Angry Ninja Roll (spicy) and Ninja Roll (non-spicy). It was delicious but the spicy roll was too much for my taste buds.   It's a small place so it gets pretty busy and sometimes you have to wait for a while for a table. The people are pleasant and always consistently making sure you have a full cup of tea or drink on your table. Keep up the good work, Sushi Twister! Thank you.
