f5PCChecc2Uhx4iOquOQvg.text: Great sushi spot in a not so great neighborhood.  Staff is very friendly & aytentive. Great food & prices.

4lRgtNwG_vejDml2Fm0Wmg.text: The sushi was excellent, and the fish was very, very fresh, with wonderful texture and taste.  I graded Sushi Twister down a star because the rice kept falling apart (in both nigiri and rolls), and the Yellow Mango wiz Shrimp roll did not have much flavor.  Everything else was outstanding in taste, particularly the Vacation Roll.    It's a new favorite sushi spot for us, and we won't hesitate to return.

XWryRq9-JMbs8LxCjBQLQA.text: This is our usual sushi place. We were trying to find a regular sushi place when we first moved here. We even went as far as the west side to try some places! (we live on the east side, near the AFB)   We love this place. Sometimes it will be pretty busy, but it's worth the wait. A few of the wait staff recognize us since we would come here almost every Friday. They have a good variety of rolls and it tastes good so I think it's fantastic. :)   A big bonus to this restaurant is that you can order half rolls! I love LOVE that because sometimes I could eat more, but might not be able to finish a full roll. It also gives me a chance to try a new roll if I'm on the fence about it.   I'm not familiar with the All You Can Eat. It'd be a waste of our money because we get full after one or two rolls.   We love this place and are glad that we found a good place not too far from our apt.

V-GT4iARMMPiCQymF-TkAQ.text: Not quite the freshness I was hoping for.  I really wanted to like this place because it's near my house and the sushi place I usually go to is VERY far away. I walked in hoping that Sushi Twister can be my new sushi home.  The plate that I was given had a piece of rice and smears all over. I didn't want to make a big deal out of it but it wasn't a great first impression. The sushi comes out relatively fast, and you can immediately tell why this is a four star venue because they are honest with the rice. In a roll or nigiri there is little rice and plenty of fish.  However, a select few of the fish was not fresh. The hamachi was a troubling, dullish hue. I was so disappointed in the hamachi because it's one of my favorites. The shrimp tasted like it had been sitting for a while. I didn't DARE order sea urchin. On a positive note, I think my favorite were the salmon eggs. It wasn't as salty as others I've tried in other venues and it was the most enjoyable, surprisingly!  I would come back because the chef are clearly skilled. I love the rice-to-fish ratio and I know that sushi places can get unlucky with the fish quality sometimes.

cXetz4Uuu1OWZG8nLSrkPg.text: Love there ginger dressing and great prices. Always fresh and fast . Top 10 sushi places

UBmam9G_Rru1CTq2FsTP_w.text: My daughter advised me of this place. The place served excellent sushi (probably one of the best I've had). The AYCE was $27 which had a large variety of rolls on the menu. I definitely loved the fact that you can order half rolls instead of the full rolls, because this gives you an opportunity to try different rolls without getting full. A lot of california sushi restaurants do not adopt the half roll concept, which is irritating.   The interior is small, which is a negative aspect because of their large fan base. The interior is clean and the staff is very busy but attend to their customers in a timely manner. The bathrooms contain single person bathrooms. The surrounding area of the restaurant does contain transient stragglers here and there,  but for the most part, they won't bother anyone.   Overall, I give this place a 5 based on their food, clean interior and staff. Great spot which people must try!!

o_H1D9F9ZTKySA2N5PYRWw.text: We've been coming here for longer than eight years . it's one of our main sushi spots. continuously Goodfood nice people and great atmosphere!!

rjVFKl3m6m0PnLGvWu4ENA.text: i absolutely love SUSHI and this is my favorite spot to go! i have been coming here for years and they never disappoint!

l-jiYXXKRmYFOk8Hcx5mVA.text: Their fish looked really fresh!  Especially the salmon.  I like a nice orange marbleized piece of salmon.  I decided to try a couple of nigiri sushi and half a roll of Matsuri.  Sushi Twister is located on the corner of Tropicana and Boulder Highway.  It's next to the gas station and shares the building with Starbucks.    Service was really fast.  The sushi chef was very friendly.    My first two orders were the salmon nigiri and the garlic tuna nigiri.  Both really fresh pieces of fish.  What I really liked about the nigiris is how firm the fish and rice are (they did not fall apart) AND the small piece of wasabi they add in the middle of the nigiri!  If you eat it all in one piece, you are sure to clear your sinuses!  My favorite part of the nigiri experience is definitely the surprise piece of wasabi!  Last, I got a half order of the Matsuri - four rolls of shrimp tempura, cucumber, tuna, drenched in Ecstasy sauce.  Ecstasy sauce contains fish eggs, mayo, ponzu, and I believe a little bit of chilli oil.  No need to dip it in soy sauce...the ecstasy sauce was amazing!    I really like how they offer both regular and half rolls, especially for times when I want to try more nigiri sushi than regular sized rolls.

6yn_SLEHHauRgtVjXFsgFg.text: I love this place.  One of my favorite sushi places in Vegas..  U gotta try the CJY or it's the CYJ it's not on the menu but so so good if you like yellow tail..

KcL0kBRxRBVU7oIVmetMWw.text: Never been to a sushi place this good!! And all you can eat for a low price so worth it !!!

myKzR30QVpPQU8yvY0nQyQ.text: Soooo great!! Wonderful happy hour and the best place to come for authentic original sushi rolls and entrees.  Such a friendly staff and wonderful management. I'll definitely be returning to this location!

4WX9x_vL9sGPm0BPa0iClQ.text: I heard about this sushi place and I think they should open another sushi Twister in downtown Henderson we need a good sushi around this area.

gTsm26dufXDPNmH_WjMDOQ.text: Chicken teriyaki dinner for under $15 is a steal. The food is great, as well as the atmosphere. Been coming here since I was a kid and I still love it.

sb_fTCuFQXMxMBi2zOiIuA.text: So so good! Must eat all you can eat place so good, good prices, nice staff!!  They give you an all you can eat paper plate so while you're eating you can choose and such also a separate all you can eat menu. I had the best time eating at the bar and the guy asking me what I want and making sure I'm ok and such. The prices are fair and don't forget to tip! Also after your all you can eat visit they give you a card they stamp every time you visit and I think it was after 9 visits you get to have all you can eat sushi for free!!

Nl4KzFoZH50BEVVUzLvQAA.text: We came here around 7ish. We were around the area and we were hungry and my husband was craving Japanese food. YELP suggested Sushi Twister. So, we tried it.   It was a small place though. I though it was a big restaurant. The lady greeted us and asked us to wait for our seat. It was kinda busy too. It was our first time for an eat-all-you-can Japanese food.   The price was reasonable. The server was japanese and she told us how it works. The service was okay. It was fast service. The sushi taste so GOOD! I mean SO GOOD! I ate almost everything in their menu. I love the salad and the miso soup. If I could go back here I would.  I love the mochi ice cream too. We went home so FULL and we were really satisfied. However, the japanese lady (I think she is the owner) when she was taking our last order, I felt like she doesn't want to take it anymore because we had too much already. LOL!   Thanks to YELP reviews, we were able to find our favorite Japanese restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love this!

y04qI7opuLT3ufH94t8NyA.text: Disclaimer: I ordered this from Uber Eats.  I am rating the food, and not the service, mostly...  My Uber Eats order consisted of two things, Chicken Karaage, which was prepared well and quite plentiful for the price.  You could get full eating just this, and I was very happy with it.  The only thing that was missing for me was a sauce if they had provided one to me on my delivery order.  The good, pretty much ended there however as my main order, the Chirashi Bowl was pretty bad.  First off, I don't like to eat tuna on must days, mainly because it's not my preferred fish to eat and I can be quite picky about it.  I had asked for this not to be present on my Chirashi Bowl, and I was fine with it being omitted and still pay full price for the meal, but they included it anyway.  The rest of the bowl was either odd tasting (octopus) and out of places, such as the smoked salmon which I don't typically encounter on a Chirashi or Japanese sushi menu.  Did I mention that the tuna was also stringy?  I'm hoping that this experience was a one off as the rest of the reviews appear to be fairly consistent.  I plan on writing a follow-up review once I get to eat at the actual restaurant.  For now, I hope that everything was a mistake and an accident.

PXVBn2BUdJPn6fistsbw1w.text: I've been here a few times years ago and remembered liking it but in my recent visit it started really good but ended so so. Enjoyed it to some point but not enough to give them the 4th star maybe 3.5 star   The good was definitely the nigiris, not a huge selection but the fish used tasted delicious and looked very fresh. The non-rice pieces were a lot larger then the size of the rice which is always great.  I basically worked my way down the list of nigiris they served. Enjoyed most of them with  the tamago and garlic tuna being just a couple of the ones I like. The one thing I didn't like about the nigiris was the rice didn't seem right or at least made to how I usually get them. They kept falling a part and tasted like it was missing something.  The uni and sweet shrimp is only offered on the dinner menu which for $4 more you can upgrade from your lunch price but I wouldn't recommend unless you really want them, what I was told, the only difference is one order of uni and sweet shrimp.  The Salmon Skin handroll wasn't that bad, two bites and it was gone. They had something called the Monkey Balls and I had to try it.  It was meh didn't care for them. It was something bitesized and fried but runny and taste so good .  I poured some of the liquids or sauce out after the 1st bite. The fried tofu is served hot so let it cool down and poke salad was a bunch of seaweed and little fish both were alright. The salmon and tuna kamas were both burnt, dry, and overcooked. The green mussles were also burnt and overcooked. The shrimp tempura were standard, ended up getting maybe 5 orders just cause I love shrimp tempura. I didn't see any oysters which are another item I love getting at sushi spots. I sampled some of the rolls not bad. I need to try more they had your usual regular, fried, and baked rolls.   Its a small place and it got busy on Saturday between lunch and dinner. The service started great and got my first orders quickly but after that there was almost 10+ min gap between me finishing my plates and them checking on me. I even got the bill early as I was still a little hungry.  Would I go back? Yes, it's still a pretty solid sushi spot for the area.

_h_y0_w1LFp9DnLES91Gqw.text: Go to Umiya or Goyemon instead  Too much rice  Their rolls (per piece) were literally 1 inch by 2 inch in mostly filled with rice.  Seaweed salad tasted a little off.. I can't put my tongue on exactly why  Their fish was fresh roughly 7 out of 10 if I had to rate it  Save your money. $27 for AYCE dinner isn't worth it

jjb_f0FlDs-ACD08CJFuVA.text: I had really high expectations for this place. After going with my sister we realized that the rice was very hard. It also had an after taste to it which was really strange. I usually eat salmon nigiri. The salmon was okay but I've had salmon in other sushi places that was amazing! Won't be returning.

wLPMjhj45bIaLwpkpFe8rA.text: We've eaten here many many times. Honestly, we mostly come here because it's close to where we live. Twister has its good points, but really only worth going to if you are hungry and close by.  The service is prompt and very friendly. The staff are great! The decor is comfortable.  We only ever come here to do the AYCE. The quality of the fish and preparation varies between good to mediocre. But it's mostly always good.  So if you want to fill up on enjoyable sushi, Twister will be good. If you want an exceptional sushi experience you may want to consider more expensive options.

AFS06X75w6N_lPigiq3vyQ.text: One of the best AYCE sushi places in town.  Everything is fresh and there's a bunch of non sushi options.  Service is good and this place is always crowded

oD6OViM9yPAhKiD235bNwg.text: The selling point about Sushi Twister is the endless rows of items you can pick from that a regular customer could possibly spend a couple months eating here without ever needing to pick the same item. Can't think about which appetizer to choose? Bad news, folks. There's more than 20 appetizers to pick with not one option being any more than $7. Did another AYCE sushi not provide enough nigiri options? This one has another 20.  I actually wasn't in the mood for rolls but just wanted some plain tasty raw seafood. I love how this place seems to understand me unlike other restaurants. I never understood the concept of wanting to buy 12 pieces of the same tuna, so they offer "mini-bowls" that provide half the portions so you can order another half of something else.  I left with a lovely Chirashi bowl. Because I'm a slow eater and have odd eating hours, I ordered it to go. Holding True to visual presentation, the my to-go had the assortment of seafood so nicely done over the rice that eating and taking it apart was almost saddening. I never thought I would feel that way about a to-go order.  For those of you who either want to try a little bit of everything and not break the bank, Sushi Twister hits the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. To go chirashi bowl....still fancy!

Mce6jJEUM7ahxAtXfW65qQ.text: This place is an AYCE sushi joint. I haven't done the AYCE because it's pretty pricey compared to other sushi restaurants I've been to but I've ordered a few of their rolls and came in a few times with family and friends.   Overall based on their menu, their selection is pretty large and I like the fact that they do half rolls for their AYCE. The restaurant is pretty small but I do enjoy that it's not as busy as Sakana. Overall everything is pretty good but the amount of rice in their nigiri is A LOT.

--QwAL3NrgkI01aMuMEhpQ.text: My boyfriend & I just happened to come across this place as we were leaving LV & I have to say this place served me the best Phily Roll I have ever had. Our server was extremely nice & informative. This restaurant has 2 meal options, a la carte or all-you-can eat. We choose a la carte sushi & every single roll was delicious. We are definitely coming back here every time we visit LV.

QB5wCpbA-UEk_0ioVUE8qQ.text: Always a great place to come have sushi.. best sushi in town ! Great atmosphere and they are pretty fast with the orders .

risWd6wgCztlaUxoB8meqw.text: Never lets us down... Angry ninja is my favorite . Great place for a quick meal! The teriyaki chicken is bomb too

KNyQLu2KHdGjk4j5p-oS6g.text: Tried for the first time. Was not terrible, but nothing special. Rice was too sticky to me and I like my fish to be colder than it was. Limited spicy options. Probably will not go back

3muK1BtFbMwzFmx3foszOw.text: Sushi Twister is one of the few AYCE spots east of Green Valley Pkwy. We came here on a Saturday afternoon because it's usually crowded and on a wait during the dinner hours. I had AYCE ($22.95) and my wife had the teriyaki box ($8.95).   My AYCE strategy is that I normally order as much variety of nigiri as I can to try and then have a roll or two. I'll usually order two orders of each fish. But here, the cuts of fish on the nigiri were so large that I only ordered one order of each fish after the first round. The sushi is solid, nothing out of the ordinary as far as selection of fish. But I was filled up pretty fast on the nigiri and didn't have room to try any of the rolls. So rolls will be on the agenda for the next visit.  It was pretty busy for being the afternoon but the service was great because they had three servers working the dining area and they worked great as a team. We'll continue to come here when were on this side of town and want sushi during non peak hours.

pHQ0q9hnoIDyOUm1v465hQ.text: Can't believe I haven't done a review yet.   We've been going here since they first opened.   Not knowing what to expect, just because the side of town it's on and not many "business" Buildings around.   But, it has done amazing through out the years.  And that's because of the delicious sushi they serve.  They have AYCE sushi and also other menu items.   The staff over the years have alway been very friendly!!!   Love it there!

uhqwx1YbPWlrX_RSvAk9lQ.text: I am in love.  Great food and service and what.......the unexpected.....amazing food that is above and beyond what other places serve.....I could spend everyday all month going through this menu.   A must try for everyone is you are looking for a hot new sushi place....here it is!

cwTw0YHpWtIEvnz4R4kDLA.text: There were 4 of us and we went on a Saturday. Small place but we got seated right away. Price was the same as other AYCE sushi places. Waiter was very friendly and attentive. My favorite thing about this place is you can order half rolls, I rarely order rolls at other places because I knew I couldn't finish it myself.  Their rice was very easy to eat, soft, warm, with a hint of vinegar.   Only con is they didn't have as many appetizer choices. We had like one or two piece left from 2 of our last rolls and when we asked for the check the waiter actually asked if we would be eating those pieces, I'm assuming it was because you get charged extra for not eating all your food, but we weren't going to order anymore and I don't even know how much he would have charged us for leaving 1 piece behind. We finished it of course but it made us feel like we over ate and as we were leaving we couldn't imagine eating sushi ever again... it wasn't a good feeling.

T0ngSQDMPrKGAj66-OnxXg.text: This place has the best sushi, one of the sushi makers is kinda of a D*** but oh well the sushis good!!! I order delivery!

eQyICX2w1IpavSTVODY2Jw.text: Love this place my friend introduce me to this place and they have really good variety of sushi to choose from and they are quick and very friendly we went to eat after the foam glow run and we were in and out at no time. I wish they would offer delievery in the future

5A5KZswkixk16rB7jYRjiw.text: Super delicious rolls!!  The people that work here are very friendly also!  I've been in 3-4 times and have had a fantastic experience each time. I would recommend the Magic Mountain Roll and the baked Japanese Lasagne Roll!  They are delicious and even when you order through uber eats or do a to go order, the food is still hot and yummy when you get to eat it.  It's a great place to eat!

W5Wd-GZJ7NQkuIw2BKpdBw.text: Dinner at this East side sushi spot is $26.95 per person. There were 2 of us and we sat at a half booth in the back. The service was fine. We ordered about 7 different things right away, and ordered more rolls after that. The server kept telling us we could order half rolls, as if he didnt think we could finish the full rolls. Ha! We sure showed him! But it is nice they have the half roll option.   The salmon loves lemon roll is deliciously refreshing, if you like lemon and salmon you must get this. The salmon nigiri and garlic tuna were my favorite of the evening, and I love that garlic sauce they use on top of the tuna. For dessert I had mango mochi and red bean ice cream. The red bean was super sweet and tasty. Just a note only one piece of mochi per person for AYCE, which I think is a little stingy. After all you are paying around $30 for dinner with tax.  I would recommend this place for sushi if you are in the area.

FM7xGJsiHmQeSnryh5OWpw.text: This is my favorite sushi spot due to their freshness, spicy selections and AYCE menu! The baked mussels and scallops are both a must try. The angry ninja ', screaming for vengence and calls doctor are my favorite spicy rolls. The nigiri and drinks are great too.

8CHwhwsxzIS1o7LCQ4oN1Q.text: We came into town again this past weekend and loved the sushi once more!  Sushi twister is one of the best in town, their spicy rolls are the best in town. Simply a wonderful experience and great environment inside :)

HvcfwduVScDDgLfdz-bgWQ.text: Great awesome sushi, I never liked shushi until I tried it for the first time at shushi twister! I tried their cooked fried sushi, the Californian roll .

P64YFlb_mVc78543b5CDRA.text: This place is close to home but I would still go out of my way to get better sushi. After reading reviews we thought this place would be a lot better quality than what we received. Granted everyone raves about their fresh fish that wasn't the case for us.   We weren't extremely hungry to do AYCE so we opted for a combo plate which had a lot of food on it. Large portion of Teri chicken, veggie tempura, salad and a California roll. For $9 this was a good deal for all the food we recieved. I ordered a San Francisco fire roll but asked for it to be tempura fries with eel sauce. My guy also ordered an order of smelt egg nigiri and I ordered an order of Garlic tuna nigiri. Both of which were not fresh. We alps recieved a salmon loves lemon roll which we did not order but we ate anyway and that was also pretty good.   Service was alright and the nigiri should have been fresh,but I would drive elsewhere for sushi even though it's convienently located close to my home.   Don't forget that yelp hours are not correct. They close at 10 not 11!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Late night specials.

3kabZ3PL18TuIf8Y1mz1nQ.text: This place has great sushi and it taste amazing. However, they don't have the best customer service. I felt rushed while eating, and it seemed like they just wanted me out the door. It also gets quite crowded for a small place. Other than the bad service they do have good tasting sushi.

88nWR2Mkh_sCyc5ThGj1vg.text: This place is the BOMB! Since I work at the same shopping center at Sushi Twister for many years, if I want to eat something different, I come here. I usually order the Chicken Lunch Special to go.   The best part is that there's lots of portions of Teriyaki Chicken,  salad, and California Roll Sushi. I love the taste and flavor they put in the Teriyaki Chicken. Would be back for more!

f6dg2u6g2Md5WKE9OdhIoA.text: I enjoyed doing AYCE. This is a small sushi place and I went during a weekday for lunch so service was very good.  I started with some nigiri- the garlic tuna and smoked salmon were enjoyable but something was a bit off with the texture that I didn't order more nigiri like I normally would. I tried 3 different rolls. My favorite was their Salmon loves Lemon - I really enjoy this light refreshing roll. The crispy vacation is a great roll for anyone who enjoys onion and garlic flavors- I will for sure get it again. The last roll I tried was the boulder crunchy. I was not impressed with their eel sauce. Also however it was prepared the seaweed inside was not done right and I almost gagged on it.  All in all I plan to come back and try more. I hope to bring someone who likes spicy rolls because they boast of having level 1-5 spicy rolls.

VWXEH7t82T2Z1L5vTU2xBQ.text: We got plans tonight, UH playing football and we are wanting some good food to enjoy while we watch the game.  So what better than some sushi!   We called ahead and ordered a tray of sushi.  When we arrived, the hostess notified the guys that we were there for the pick up and it took about ten minutes to complete.    Once home, we looked it over and found they provided three big wallops of wasabi and pickled ginger.  And we loved the spicy tuna, the caterpillar roil and the dragon.  It was a great mix, the ahi was pink and fresh.  Definitely a good choice.

NZuq44cRM2Ph1ClTcoV35Q.text: Mmm..  4 stars .. sushi Volcano very yummy!!!!!! I'm recommend it! But not have herbal tea...  Not napkins on the table.. Sushi with Tuna very salt! ( (( I don't eating it.......

oPz0O3VR763UbbffbFLdRA.text: We came here on a Saturday night, around 9ish, and ordered 2 AYCE for $68ish (dinner buffet is 28)  - Next to starbucks. Near Eastside Cannery Casino. - Easy parking. Great timing. No wait. Seated right away.  - Sit at bar for faster sushi service.  - For appetizers, order from waitress.  - Friendly waitress. She actually told us she doesn't mind if you don't eat all your rice. Just try your best. haha!  - Amazing sushi chef! We had the legit old Japanese guy.  - My method of attack: 1. Get all the items with a happy face on it. That means that they are expensive and limit one per person. 2. Get the items with the moon icon for dinner only.  3. Look for the most expensive rolls.  4. Save room for the mochi.  - My recommendations unique to Twister  1. Island tuna poki: good side with sushi 2. Screaming orgasm: great appetizer 3. Salmon loves lemon: for salmon sashimi lovers 4. Spider-Man: for soft shell crab lovers 5. Rum jungle: Great japanese salsa taste - Only AYCE that I've been to where you can get 1/2 a roll! Great for selection.  - Compared to Goyemon, you can't get grilled fishes here.  - Come for the unique sushi selection.

CCJ67JLtb8Iqvg0HrzqYHg.text: Nice and fresh very tasty .Dang was our chef  and very friendly and professional. .great job !

KBt2epGu8qGK1X_2E5czMw.text: OK Sushi Twister hands down is the BEST all you can eat sushi establishment I have been to. From the moment you walk in the door you are greeted and immediately seated. There is no time wasted and the servers are already getting water and asking your beverage order. The ambiance was wonderful good natural light and very nice Asian Decor throughout. I sat at a high top table with my friends but the sushi bar looked very inviting, and all the sushi cooks were nice and well presented. Our server and busser were very prompt both bringing the sushi and clearing empty plates, our glasses were never empty. The owner came over towards the end of our meal and greeted us with a very warm smile and asked about our meal. I cannot praise this sushi restaurant enough from the staff, to the food and ambiance amazing and the very involved owner makes me give this place 5 stars! I appreciate seeing such customer service and integrity in an age where those simple traits are diminishing.

Q7KV7RjZGVQh76ninaeA5g.text: YOU HAVE GOT TO TRY THIS PLACE! I never imagined I would like sushi. My life changed when I came here. A few of my favorites (for those who aren't crazy about nigiri sushi/raw fish) are Dead dragon, Cowgirl, Salmon Loves Lemon, Magic Mountain, and Japanese Lasagna. I also LOVE the Shrimp Tempura, which is unlimited with the All You Can Eat Sushi. Everything about this place is amazing... Can't get enough.

ZriGISilBE41T-1mA9bQpg.text: Fine. They were packed so that is a good sign. I think the rating may be more on my choice of food options should have maybe stuck with the rolls. Szlw_1XmMXxeAGv4IRP8Vg.text: I would have given more stars because the food usually is very good and service is great. But I ate there just a few days ago with my boyfriend and both of us got food poisoning. Still sick as I write this. We are calling the manager today.

YrXMV2aaFuuxKqfWNO6E6g.text: Great food in a low key environment. The lunch combos have plenty of food at great prices. We were full from that and we're happy we did not go with the all-you-can-eat choice!

0_wWto3ImvCrS0tr9XvHkg.text: My new sushi spot in Vegas. Been to many spots for sushi and this place is legit . Highly recommended

NkL1FEbV4LXQ68V-wUS0vg.text: We eat here pretty often and the sushi is always good. Today, I tried the hot food the twister lunch special.  Grill salmon with teriyaki chicken twister special for $8.95 it came with miso soup rice and 1/2 cali roll. Ok, first the sushi chefs here are really good and I do not want everyone to confuse them with the hot food cooks.  My only complaint is please clean the bloodline out of the salmon before you cook it. Second, if you are going to leave the skin on the grilled salmon great. BUT, don't cover the Krispy skin with a glaze.   Also, the servers need to bus their tables more often.  We hate sitting for 25 min with empty plates in front of us. Advice, for the owner/manager hire a busser for your busy times, you will turn tables faster.  All in all its a great place for sushi, lunch and dinner we will continue to eat at sushi twister

0jsMR6-iX3EqCQSQrS0CBw.text: We tried a lot of items on the menu and i must say that their chicken tonkatsu is the best! I recommend you to try San Francisco and Dragon if you prefer sushi. The salmon teriyaki is not so good and really pricey. Its an okay japanese restaurant. Nothing superb

I1IYqOotdHjQdAVXnEu6xA.text: I eat at this place a few times a month. They are so good and the staff is very nice. They've never messed up an order and I've been going there for over a year. It's busy some nights so hurry up and get there sooner rather than later. Dine in or take out is both good. Great service every time.

AmfCjselzfZ_xBF4xa0jyw.text: This is my favorite sushi place. It can be busy around lunchtime and it's a small place so it gets crowded quickly. Tasty and personal.

ggkc5usbVnEu2e_tr1ZgxQ.text: This is the best sushi joint if you live east of Eastern or anywhere on the east side in Las Vegas.  I've ate here over 30 times, 3 stamp cards to prove it.  And every time I dine here it is fresh.  I almost always order all you can eat.    But if I don't  then I'll order one of their lunch/dinner teriyaki plates (chicken, beef, salmon, etc.)  I like ordering the dish with the teriyaki on the side and adding it to my protein in the amount I want.  The staff has expanded since this place has become really popular.  They are all nice and friendly.  The bar and tables are always clean and the sushi masstttaasss behind the counter always bid you farewell.  If they're not busy making bomb diggity bomb sushi!  I love any type of nigiri, they do have special sushi rolls too.  Crunchy Roll is one of my fav but I really love me a lot of nigiri.  They have specials too, just look up on a wooden board on the wall.  They have a projection screen, a wide screen but not necessary.    I wish this place had not gotten popular so I can keep it to myself!

I4KxATYJ7zj0lbhX65GO9Q.text: I ordered delivery through uber eats and was not super impressed with the food. I  ordered 3 things, the teriyaki chicken which was the best of the three, no complaints there. The california roll just wasn't very good, can't put my finger on why. The shrimp tempura roll was just shrimp and cucumber, there was no description on the online menu so I didn't know what to expect, but compared to other shrimp tempura rolls I have had this one wasn't good. The food was ready very quick and prices were good.

_pV_j7hW7KEEyhiytGDkzQ.text: My husband I have tried a lot of AYCE sushi places in Vegas and this is our all time favorite. They have a huge menu. My hubby likes the raw and spicy stuff and I am all about the cooked and non-spicy. It was hard to find a place with a large selection of both. But Sushi twister has it all. And the non-raw sushi is not just different versions of the California roll like a lot of sushi bars have. Lots of appetizers too.   My favs are scallop twister without hot sauce, spiderman and the OMG and my husband swears by the sushi twister, rum jungle and rainbow roll.

yMT2oQxW7o-E3pFeR-DVyw.text: Craving all you can eat sushi? Well... if you're in the area, throw this place under your radar! Sushi Twister has the fastest service I have experienced at a sushi restaurant.  I went here on a Saturday night with a party of three, after golfing in Tuscany.  I wasn't sure if there was going to be anything around for miles... but sure enough we came across this little sushi joint on yelp, so we decided to try it.   It's located in a pretty odd place... small building behind a 7-11 in the lot of an Albertsons... yeahhh weird. Building looked like it was cut out of a strip mall from chinatown...   But anyways, back to the story... as we were driving there I called ahead to make a reservation, the hostess had informed me that they only accept reservations after 9pm, but since I was calling ahead 10 minutes she put us down. As we got there we were seated promptly, there were a few tables still open. All of us chose all you can eat which cost $26.95 a person, same rules as anywhere else except you can only be seated for one hour for all you can eat. At first I was slightly offended by the rule, but it didn't seem like they enforced it much and the service definitely made up for it.   What I found especially great about this place was the speed of service and sushi quality. I think we waited a total of 15 minutes from being seated to having our first roll delivered to our table. This was awesome and the rest of the rolls were no exception! Not only that but the portion sizes were great too, some rolls only had 5 pcs so if you didn't like the taste it was bearable and if you wanted me, heck that's why it's all you can eat, at least you wouldn't be stuck stuffing rolls in napkins.   What I didn't like... the plating and atmosphere. The plating was a little disappointing in comparison to the presentation and quality of the sushi. It really bothers me when sushi restaurants use plastic or lightweight plates/bowls... it definitely had an effect on my perception of the overall experience. Also the music totally felt out of place and took away from the average sushi bar look and, it sounded like they were blasting Mix 94.1... I remember hearing a song by My Chemical Romance at one point. Not really sure how that gets you in the mood for sushi... but luckily I was in a group and able to tune it out...   Recommendations:  Hands down the best roll for the night was the Angry Ninja, it had a bit of a kick to it but the warm crunchy goodness was delicious!  The Mango Moji had a very realistic flavor to it and tasted delicious as well!  Overall, my expectations were definitely exceeded... I wasn't expecting to have quality sushi from a small joint behind a 7-11... I was very satisfied with the speed of service 5/5, the sushi quality was also a 4/5, however the plating and atmosphere/vibe of the place was off 3/5 for each...  If you want fast quality sushi then this place is for you!

6-E5HriiqgvF8hBNJkxF5g.text: Started out at Sushi twister with some hot appetizers such as jalapeno popper, the Aurora shrimp, fried calamari, and the chicken karage.  First was Nigiri Sushi of yellowtail, albacore, and eel.  My first roll the matsuri,is a shrimp tempura cucumber wrapped in spicy tuna and light tuna with very little sauce. The second order was of the signature Sushi twister which is shrimp tempura cucumber wrapped in tuna. The third was a rum jungle which is deep fried soft-shell crab crab meat and cucumber wrap with spicy tuna and Albacore. I made a point to order all the rolls with no sauce.  My second order of the hot chicken karage, I ordered with  sriracha sauce.  Almost forgot to order the much reviewed about salmon loves lemon roll, which is fresh salmon with lemon in a California roll.  As my stomach is filling up I just asked for a bit of a taste and that's when i ordered (see picture) of the salmon with a bit of avocado on top and lemon. That should have been my dessert. Creamy. Finished dinner with the green tea ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small taste of salmon loves lemon roll

HaDjgUOd0XjeYBbKAFkMIA.text: Bomb.com! It was 5 of us doing all you can eat, we sat at the bar and they were slanging rolls for us left and right. All of them were soooo fudging good! In love and will be back again and again.

YToJ843xJgJfXybm7pwpcQ.text: Brought five of us here after hiking Goldstrike all day, and everyone really enjoyed everything. I've been to many, many sushi restaurants in town, and this is one of the best (at the moment, since quality can change). The rolls are awesome and the nigiri is awesome.

YeDFWT0RV1nfwLCZqdhGTw.text: Okay usually trying a new place and scoring it 5 stars hardly ever happens to me .but last night I came in with my sister and her kids the food was so satisfying from the moment we walked in to the very end our experience was perfect so perfect I'm here again today for lunch . Wow I'm so happy I came back again I'm having a great meal. The sushi is great and so is the customer service they are all very attentive like filling up your cup.... Thanks for the awesome service and Food!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Twister - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half orders

s_lqBOLPX6gGM-JGQzoxpA.text: Solid sushi selection and a variety of creative rolls. It is the focal point of this establishment and got me to venture away from my normal nigiri fixation. In fact, my normal means of choice is lackluster at Sushi Twister. They offer many of the quintessential fishes, but nothing particularly unique.  On the other had, the rolls were not predominantly tempura shrimp based, so my two friends and I went crazy on them. The spice levels next to some rolls made for an exciting adventure, but sometimes falls short of what was promised. I did not find any of the level fives to be unbearable or even tongue tingly. Instead they had a controlled heat that went well with the other components. The Crunchy, Angry Ninja, Kill Samurai were all good. We were even surprised by how much we liked the Cowgirl. Normally we would not order a beef roll, but the meat was tender and cooked medium.  The appetizers comprised of many standard options and a few specials. The oysters are a must get if they are offered. One order per person is the limit, but the two large bivalves should not be passed up. The Monkey Ball is also becoming more common. The spicy tuna stuffed mushroom comes as a single ball, order more if there are multiple people.

PfXBOsHnTPdFMt9YimYmFA.text: The Boulder roll is heaven. Highly recommend this place. AYCE is $24/person and includes all the rolls on the menu. Good quality food and solid service.

IlXiErJfgDEHlqfwnob6kA.text: Down right the best of the AYCE Sushi places in town! This isn't my first time coming here and it certainly won't be the last. First time was for my birthday and this review will be for yesterday. We entered the restaurant just before a rush, so we got in right away and were seating. The Sushi chefs and waiters/waitress' were all very quick to respond to what we needed and were very friendly.   Rolls are very good here, though a lot of them contain fillers (Almost all had cucumber), highly recommend the Matsuri and Tiger Yamazaki rolls. I also had their Angry Ninja roll which was suppose to be one of the hottest rolls they had, sadly it wasn't hot enough for this man to burn, but hey the taste of the habanero sauce was hot, sweet, and just all around good for people who aren't more accustomed to hot foods like myself.  But for me with any Sushi place I go to, its all about the Nigiri. To me, if a place cannot do nigiri right then I don't have high hopes for anything else in the place. I had just about every type they had and all of them were very fresh, they actually season the rice unlike most places as well.   Worth a drive and the price.

FRSFMMstPGE0J408NNKQ1Q.text: My guy friend took me here for a belated birthday lunch, & I must say it was worth the drive since we live on the other side of town. Since it was my first time & my friend was bragging about how good the sushi is, we did mostly half rolls. This is probably the most sushi I've ever tried in one sitting :P Thank goodness for those half rolls! Anyway, the server was helpful & attentive. Right when you come in there is an anti-bacterial foam dispenser :) We were sitting in the middle of the restaurant at one of the higher tables. I don't remember them having a tv, but they did have a projector screen above the entry to the restrooms. They also have a Sushi Twister point card; after 10 all you can eat purchases you get one free~  Nigiri garlic tuna - it tastes just how it's described. delicious :P  N.Z. Mussels - not big on mussels, but the eel sauce & cream cheese made it taste better for me!  Call a doctor VS Friday the 13th - the sauces come on the side, but I really enjoyed this roll. it took me another 5 minutes to take another piece, but it was great. the habanera [isn't it habanerO? hm] is what got me  Ecstasy - I barely remember this roll because the Call a dr. was still burning my mouth. haha, but I know it was tasty! Spicy tuna with cucumber inside with more tuna on top  Spider Man - soft shell crab, cucumber, crab meat thats deep fried with eel sauce always gets me ;) dont forget the shrimp on top!!  Angry Ninja - this was new to the menu, same as the ninja roll but with habanera sauce on top. I dont know why, but that habanera sauce always felt like it was burning UNDER my tongue too. haha, weird  Magic Mountain - super duper light. there was barely any rice in this roll, so if you wana take a break with the carbs, eat this!!  Crispy Vacation - Most of the time I have soy sauce with my sushi, but this was the ONLY roll I dipped into soy sauce. Not as much flavor as I wanted, but then again those spicy rolls were probably still messing with my taste buds :/  Japanese Lasagna - This was my friend's favorite roll & he always gets it when we eat sushi. Honestly, they taste the same to me cause there's so much going on. I'm not hating though! I prefer to eat the baked rolls when I'm juust about to get full  Salmon Loves Lemon - I don't remember ever having a roll like this, but it was good! The sourness from the lemon was perfect since the lemon slice was super thin :9  Volcano - same description as Japanese lasagna.. and I have never had these many rolls in one sitting! BLAH  Oh My God - having soft shell crab & eel sauce is cheats! haha, I enjoyed it & my friend said "it lives up to it's name.. OMG!!"  For dessert we had mango mochi ice cream & green tea ice cream. By this time I'm ready to explode from all the sushi. I went into the women's restroom [no, I did not #2 in the restroom! haha]. The signs on the door are so cute btw! But it was very clean & even had a nice floral scent in there. Sushi Twister, you had me at the foam hand sanitizer!! I will return with my boyfriend asap.

aQpt4yH6vHBLNm0dTh2qQg.text: Over-all this is the best sushi spot in vegas by all means!! My hubby and I will never change we love this place! Reason for it is that the quality and flavor is over the top. If you like sausy sushi like we do  then this is the place!! They have many different kindas and the japanese sauce is amazing!! This place I recommend to everyone to at least try it's worth the price!!

Reym0Q_QtNNKzgx4BNwZpw.text: We love coming here! We've moved across the valley, and still make it to this East Vegas spot once a month. I love their infused rolls. Great customer service and excellent fresh food!  The only thing I wish they would change would be to give the children's menu more options (and not more microwaved options).

qeN7kkFe5TsngSa-h3wfag.text: Nothing but good things to say.  Phenomenal service and good fish.  Rolls not only taste good but show the attention to detail. Get the "Screaming O" and "baked dynamite" appitizer.  For nigiri the garlic tuna is very good and the seared tuna as well. My go to spot with the girlfriend.

O6oLXKEO-gfF931k8oe2Xg.text: Tried this place for the first time and thought it was good. Services was good, food was good, and price was decent. Expected great based on previous reviews but at least I wasn't disappointed. Alaskan Summer was pretty satisfying... Cowgirl was also satisfying. Waiter did not miss a beat when it came to filling me up with soda, so that made me happy. Give this place three stars because I've had better, and I've had worse.

yZfi17KsQ1Ty7_su5qnf4g.text: Wowowowowowow really good fresh sushi get the deluxe sashimi dinner choices hand picked by sushi chef :)

Ll0sf6SC-4aGdaTYJwMHeg.text: First time I went...a pretty seedy part of town...but the sushi was on point.  I should have taken some pics!  The rice was not over bearing, the sushi was fresh, and just over all delicious...the price was even a few bucks less than most AYCE places! Just really delicious and worth the risk to go to "tweekertown" :)

Yz8ro1Bg3VHu41uMh6VjJg.text: Sushi Twister is my go to place for sushi in Las Vegas. Quality fish, excellent service and a fair price. What more could I ask for.

szOoymkEXloOlKH0GSVnoA.text: Great little spot! I really enjoyed the AYCE deal. The waitstaff was friendly and the sushi was tasty! Enjoy!!!

KcMrho_Bwkr3ZA985T9QVA.text: This place was packed on a Sunday night. My friend and I had to wait for a seat at the bar for about 10min standing. I got an O my god roll and a Twister roll. They were freakn Delicious!  The sushi chef that made our food was very pleasant and looked excited to be there. I only gave it four stars though because i didnt try the actual sushi yet, but i definetly will be coming back.

kycrjCiX4bfDzrK6Da2r7g.text: Very good sushi. I go here frequently although the all you can eat could be $5 cheaper. :p Love the feel to this restaurant too..very hip.

gL3gHotmFTKcDrYC7sxffg.text: Good sushi. Always clean and friendly.  Sometimes when i order the salmon nigiri it comes out warmer than expected. Cool atmosphere,  especially they have a projector that plays movies /tv on the wall. Neato

v7UGQNScilXqhIpRv9thhw.text: This place is always packed! I really like their gyoza here and there are some awesome rolls on the menu. Best Sushi on the eastside!

M7PucHq7FqjDRa4D_pm-sA.text: Great combos meals with a great value. Sushi was great. Even the boring "California roll" was nice. Special rolls are great! Loved their tampura as well.

883ymTN_iiH55I0CYqVW-g.text: Service was very good  food was ok,  a little pricey for dinner.  Cons- it was so hot in the restaurant it was very uncomfortable,  many customers were fanning themselves,  we asked about the AC,  they said it was on and they had two small ceiling fans going but they were up so high they made no difference.  Place could have been a lot cleaner.  I won't return.
